Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: StefanieC19
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect...about 3 minutes away from the entrance to the theme parks. Breakfast is exactly what you'd expect "continental" to be. Staff was friendly & helpful. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,clean room,bad maintenance,bad fitness room,poor service,horrible food”
Reviews.Author: Amazzoni
Reviews.Content: Like the location,rooms are excellent,price great.really needs a new fitness room,food expensive and not good. Had me wait two hours before check in.lovely hotel,needs work,though.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Rservidio
Reviews.Content: We got there and they didn't have our room ready. We came back a couple hours later and they were out of our room completely and since we had already paid we were forced to be downgraded and they refused any type of compensation. It was Saturday night at 5pm and they had no manager on duty or anyone who could help with the problem. Later that night we asked for a tooth brush and we were told we had to buy a toothbrush/ toothpaste combo for $2. There was only one front desk person on duty at a time and the service was horrible. Would not recommend to anyone or ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: We arrived a bit early and they let us check in, which was great, but that night after walking around Disney all day, we got in our room and the a/c was so loud we could'nt stand it, then it just shut off. We called the desk and they said they would change our room, we did not want to do that at 10 at night. next day they offered a room down the hall, the a/c was even louder! Finally that night they changed our room. Also the ice machine only worked on the 5th floor and the filterwas dirty.Breakfast ends too early for people on vacation and it's tooooo crowded, could'nt get near the food! Not Happy!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: lb_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Galleria hotel is family-friendly and it's conveniently located to local attractions. The hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Breakfast is average, but it's free. We stayed at the hotel 4 nights in February 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: lzk2
Reviews.Content: Our room had two queen beds, a refrigerator, coffee maker with coffees, toiletries in the bathroom, complimentary WiFi, complimentary mini breakfast, and is overall a remarkably good deal. Oh, the best part is the price! Great deal there!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: maddy t
Reviews.Content: Ok place to stay for the price. -close to the parks -rooms were clean -wasn't enough towels in the bathroom if you wanted to go swimming -pillows were really thick -rooms were very dark, not enough lightning -there is a shuttle but it has random times and stops at 3 other hotels so it is very crowded on the bus -elevators were very slow -hallways need updated -problems with the door cards -breakfast wasn't the best.. tasted like scrambled eggs cooked in the microwave, canned fruit and cornflakes every day. toaster took a long time and you had to toast things twice

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine... shuttle service a joke”
Reviews.Author: JC0713
Reviews.Content: I was down in orlando for a conference that took place on the Disney property. Owing to the conference and other spring-break vacationers, we could not find an open room at any of the Disney resorts. Thus, we choose the galleria palms as it seemed cleaned, is located close to the Disney property, and claimed to have a complimentary shuttle to all the Disney parks. The rooms were fine for $90 a night, the breakfast was pretty bad, and, worst of all, the shuttle was essentially non-existent. The shuttle is operated by a third party, runs only a few times a day and stops at numerous other hotels. As an example, the first ride of the day leaves for seaworld (the only shuttle to sea world for the day) -- about 16 miles from the Galleria -- at 7:20am... but doesnt arrive until 8:45am! Coming back from sea world there is also only one shuttle. This is the same for all other parks (epcot, magic kingdom, etc.) albeit transportation once on the disney resort is pretty easy... and actually finding the shuttles on time is another story. Thus, you will end up taking a lot of taxis, which run between 20 and 40 each way. I would not recommend staying here if your goal is to get up to the Disney property. You may save some money, but the transportation costs and headaches will negate this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: ksnm
Reviews.Content: On earlier trips, we had the bad luck to have been staying at dumps that were called Hotels. So, when deciding on where to stay during our trip to Orlando, we really did take some time and research before we decided to commit to this hotel. 1. Free breakfast 2. Free parking We are happy with our choice of this Hotel, and will certainly stay at the same place on our next visit. This trip was for visiting Disney World, Sea World and Universal Parks. Since we were not going to spend much time on Hotel premises, we were not interested in a Resort Hotel. Although this Hotel had a pool and a small gym, we had absolutely no time to use any. It is 2 miles from Animal Kingdom. You can see Animal Kingdom from the upper floors. Few miles to all the other parks as well. Dozens of all types of restaurants on the main road. Supermarket and gift stores across the street. The supermarket was a good help. We stocked up supplies for water, snacks to carry to the Parks. The water in the parks costs $2.50 per bottle. We purchased 24 bottles for $7.99 and kept them in the car trunk. Daily free breakfast - bread, gravy, scrambled eggs (or pork). And them oatmeal, cereal, juice, milk, canned fruit, and a whole lot of usual breakfast items. That saved our breakfast money every single day. Rooms were in great condition. The appearance was also nice. It was not the usual gaudy Hotel appearance. Staff -- super courteous, helpful, friendly. Guest services -- super courteous, helpful, friendly. Checkin/out -- clean. ----------------------------------- Suggestions to the Hotel: ----------------------------------- 1. Room has adequate light bulbs, but light is inadequate. There should be at least 1 or 2 bulbs with more light. All the bulbs have very low light. 2. Fresh fruits for breakfast (instead of canned fruits). 3. Real bagels for breakfast. People from New York like Bagels -- white bread cannot replace bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to sleep - this will do”
Reviews.Author: pilot2643
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disneys Grand Floridian two years ago ( 3 nights). Exceptional !. Paid almost 450.00 per night. Left the room at 7AM; returned after park hopping around 11PM. Never got to enjoy the perks of my 450.00 per night room at that beautiful resort. That being said, we knew our schedule would be the same so we just needed a place close to Disney to "land" , refuel and take off again. This place is fine. No fancy anything- but I can say this; CLEAN. I had seen other reviewers say it was or wouldn't have booked here. Bedroom, bathroom were spotless; people cleaning in halls and lobby when we left, and returned. Beds are a little firm, hallways and outside need some updating. For this price point (avg 75.00) OK breakfast included;- very fair ! Easy access from I-4; 3 mi. straight in on 192 (on right - easy to miss / behind the I-Hop). Animal Kingdom 5 min; Magic Kingdom 7 min. Plenty of restaurants in surrounding area. Not quite sure I agree with the 6.99 "resort fee" they charge per night- seems pointless; no resort here. But hey- it sure beats 450.00.

Reviews.Title: “OK ...TILL WE CK'D OUT.”
Reviews.Author: linmari
Reviews.Content: At first ... they would NOT honor our CAA...they said it was not the same as AAA. I finally talked to the manager and they said they would honor it. Got the receipt at check out...and CAA discount was NOT honored. I pointed it out and they said, 'Well it already went through on the credit card so there is nothing we can do about it now. This really was POOR customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for solid accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: If you aren't looking for over the top amenities, but solid accommodations at a fair price, this is a great option. Minutes to Disney by car. Decent breakfast... just don't come late, they clean up at 9am on the clock. Also the shuttle buses are a little oddly timed, so plan to drive if you have little ones.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Rafael H
Reviews.Content: For sixty somthing a day I'de say this is as much bang for the buck as you can get. With all the contemporary furniting like granite counter tops & clean updated ameneties it's way better than any old nasty dingy Inn. Yes, clearly it's not a five star hotel but it's better than staying at some "whole in the wall" Inn. It's nice to not come tired to oxidated showers with nasty grime all over. The beds are wonderfull in my opinion, nice flat screen TVs, a CLEAN pool, clean shower, free breakfast, free wi-fi, I mean... What more could you want or expect for a bargain hotel? Now, my last stay was in june 2008 & planing on going back around april.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: markpecz
Reviews.Content: Good BASIC accommodations. This was a trip to Disney with the grand-kids and we were not going to stay in the room much. However we want a clean, comfortable place to stay. Apart from the running faucet in the bathroom and the sparse supply of towels this hotel meet our needs at a low cost. Breakfast was a little disappointing but for the price of the hotel I cant complain too much. It does not look as good in person, but it wasn't too far off. The location to the parks was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a bit misleading”
Reviews.Author: HillCountryTexan
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was clean, staff polite. Didn't go out of their way to be helpful but would help when asked. Continental breakfast was convenient but lacking. Room - neat, clean. However, two faucets leaked in a stream of water that would not turn off. Had to close the bathroom door in order to sleep. AC was adequate. Cons - The shuttle was not convenient AT ALL. i.e. Shuttle pick up from Epcot was 10:45 p.m. - park closed at 9 p.m. The pool was NOT heated (We had called and were verbally told it WAS heated). Rooms were dark. 4 people in room, only had 3 towels despite repeated requests for additional towels. Housekeeping staff did not speak English. Area hotels were significantly less with advertised heated pool but we did not check them out. Was there for only 4 days. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but does not look as good in person.”
Reviews.Author: jojoba p
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with family the last week of January. Hotel looked much nicer online. The staff were friendly and the continental breakfast was average. The rooms however had many stains on the carpets and didn't have much light. The pool was not heated which was a bit of a disappointment. There were many other hotels in the area with much cheaper rates that looked much better. We even considered switching mid week. Sorry Galleria Palms, but we definitley will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Have been staying here for 3 consecutive years.”
Reviews.Author: ReBoj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite close to Disney World and it is located in the middle of lots of good restaurants and souvenir shops ( IHOP is right outside the hotel ). The hotel itself is clean and very comfortable. The bedrooms are nicely done without any of the overly gawdy printed carpets and bedcovers, however, the carpets are a little stained. The staff is very helpful and friendly ( esp the reception staff - thank you guys ! ).Checking in and out is simple. We were there for 11 days and enjoyed our stay very much. The breakfast is adequate and replenished timely. They have the usual assortments of cinnamon rolls, various mini muffins, cereals, instant oatmeal packets, breads ( bagels are a little sparse ), juices, coffee, tea packets and some scrambled eggs, and biscuits and gravy. I DO SINCERELY WISH THEY ADD THE WAFFLE MAKER !!!!!! Apart from the resort fee they charge ( $ 6.99 per day ) which I do not understand as they are not a resort ! They need to take that off. Also every Sunday they reset all the key cards, so we had to go to the reception Sunday night to have our key cards reset. They have wifi in the rooms too . We will definitely be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but the travel time to the Disney Parks is priceless! It's so close and so easy to get to. The room was very clean and updated and the beds were very comfortable. Checking in and out was simple, the breakfast was good for free. It even included warm foods like eggs and biscuits and gravy. It was a great deal for the experience and the comfort of knowing it was a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: shannon s
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the galleria for four nights and three days ..it was a good overall experience the staff was helpful and the hotel was close to alot of the parks. our room was very well cleaned daily..we really had no problems i just didnt understand why there was a resort fee it was more like a hotel the pool isnt over the top and there wasnt any planned activies for the children like the other resorts we've stayed at .. we recieved a very good price and they also give discounts to florida redidents and military. The free breakfest also good they had eggs toast beside ceral and fruit ,,defently a plus when you have children. i would reconnmend this hotel as long as your not looking to be pampered its a great place to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: KingJaz
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on tripadvisor and got general idea of what to expect before booking my stay in this hotel. In general this is a good hotel with some hiccups. It is clearly not a 4 or 5 stars hotel but very decent. Room was clean, some stains on the carpet. One faucet in the washroom wasn’t working but managed to use the other one. I agree with some reviews about the dim lighting in room. Swimming pool is a bit small. Internet wasn’t very efficient but served the purpose. No in room safe and safe offered at reception were full. Breakfast was ok but management need to add more people to serve guests when hotel at full capacity.

Reviews.Title: “El aire es fatal waooo que calor”
Reviews.Author: Peluye
Reviews.Content: El servicio del aire de la habitación es fatal los tienen controlados y hace calor no se descansa sientes todos los pasos de la persona de arriba. Apagan el aire de los pasillos y la calor es inmensa el personal del hotel ni saluda. Bien localizado, restaurantes cerca y bastante limpio aunque esta un poco descuidado en sus alrededores o habitación obscura las luces son de poco watts y apenas puedes ver tienes que correr la cortina para ver o vestirte. Lo mismo en las afueras del hotel muy obscuro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room at a Super Price”
Reviews.Author: sailingstarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. We paid about $180 for three nights all included and the room would have slept four people for this price. The rooms are huge with two double beds. The decor appears to be very recent with neutral colors of beige, gold and black, very similar to that of a much more expensive hotel. The bathroom was large and very clean with a beauiful black granit counter. . We specially appreciated the nice breakfast included in the price. Although advertised as "continental", there were scrambled eggs and either sausage or Southern biscuits. High speed internet, also included, worked perfectly. The hotel is located off the main road meaning no noise at all at night. The receptionist from Morocco was specially helpful. We did not use the free shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and a good value”
Reviews.Author: CSCTampa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a Disney weekend visit. It's close to the parks, loads of restaurants, and has free parking and wi-fi. The staff was friendly and accomodating and the breakfast was adequate. (Free breakfast for a family of 4, even if it's somewhat limited, is a huge savings.) The beds and pillows were clean and comforatable, and the bathroom was beautiful. All of this for a great price. (Discounts are available for FL and GA residents and teachers and first responders.) Having said that, the breakfast was somewhat limited (but the scrambled eggs were great!), and was rather busy. The carpet in the room had seen better days, and the internet was a bit spotty. However, for the price we paid it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is just ok”
Reviews.Author: Edjavier
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ok; i liked the modern look of the room, but i had a bit of a problem with the carpet "not so clean :(". I haven't seen anybody complaining about the carpet, so i guess it was just the room that i got; i don't know, but for me, a dirty old looking carpet is not acceptable. The price is ok, but watch out for the 6 dollar resort fee. The fee is not much, but then again, i would not call this hotel a resort by any means. Personally i felt that i should have spent the exta bucks to book a named brand hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice...don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: cdnchopsuey
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal here through Hotwire and that is the only thing that got us through the whole week. I would have been choked if we had paid full price. Staff was rude and dismissive when I complained about the faulty internet - I was sneered at and told that I have been the only person to complain the entire time they've been working at the hotel. I had no problems accessing internet in the lobby. The room was filthy. Aside from the condom wrapper beside the night table greeting us when we first got into the room, the bed covers had very obvious food (uh, at least I hope it was food) caked onto it. Carpet was very badly stained. Wiping down the tables and bathroom with a lysol wipe showed how little pride the hotel takes in cleanliness. Breakfast was okay but unless you're downstairs at 6:59AM, food disappears pretty quickly. If you have a choice, DO NOT stay here. But if you do, bring your own bedsheets and lysol wipes and don't count on any internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blktoy
Reviews.Content: Loved it was clean staff was great and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Great Price. Needs a touch up.”
Reviews.Author: Smaycumber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to checking in at the Disney Resorts. We booked through hotels.com. Upon arrival found out they offer the same price on their website without the $15 service fee. We booked in the car on the drive from Atlanta. After booking, I attempted to call the property for 6 straight hours to notify them of our late arrival. They never answered the phone. I called hotels.com back to share my concern and they attempted to reach them with no luck either. Hotels.com agreed to put me up in a different hotel if I arrived at the property and didn't have a room. At arrival I informed the person behind the desk who said the phones have been working, so I was left to believe he was too lazy to answer all day for both me and the hotels.com support staff. When we got to our rooms, they both had a smell of mildew to them. The manager moved us across the hall and it was much better. Rooms were comfortable and quiet. Electronic checkout was seamless and the warm breakfast was nice. (Eggs and biscuits with sausage gravy, assorted fruits and breads.) I'd stay there again because the price is unbeatable. Just make sure you are happy with your room and don't expect to get themed the phone prior to arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Decent.. not bad.. worth the money.. Recommend for None Rich people”
Reviews.Author: tedman007
Reviews.Content: Good, decent.. no complaints.. except.. breakfast kind of keep.. internet only works on some floors.. Ask for good internet floor.. beware of ticket scammers around town and time share.. But hotel is good for those wanting to rest cheap and clean and back to parks.. recommended. Internet OK on fourth floor...Very similar to Hamptons and Wingate's FYI

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kgrant80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! Friendly people, huge rooms, and a great price. And it is extremely close to Disney. My only complaint is that seating for their breakfast is very limited so I just took it to my room!

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay, April-11, so-so place to rest your head...”
Reviews.Author: lauraling21
Reviews.Content: It's nothing extraordinary, but it's clean, and a great location. A nice place to lay your head for a few nights. If you're only sleeping here (as my husband and I were for a short anniversary trip to Disney), then it will do just fine. I'm not quite sure what people were expecting for breakfast at a ~$60/night room. It was hot, a bit of variety, nothing over the top fantastic but it did the job. The rooms - were clean and updated, though a little musty-smelling like any hotel in the wetlands of Florida - again, what do you expect? Room was clean, as was the bathroom and very modern looking. The microwave, coffee maker and fridge in the room was nice to have. However - we did have a huge problem with the fridge "knocking." We asked for maintenance every morning and evening, and it never got fixed. Annoying. Wi-fi worked so-so for us in the room. Not as great as home, but it did the job. Rest of the hotel - The halls and lobby (and elevator) could use a good updating. Especially the furniture in the lobby....gross! The pool was kind of gross looking and small (you could not see the bottom), but again, we were just there to rest our heads after exhausting, all-day trips to the theme parks. If that's what you're looking for and nothing extra, this is a good hotel for you. I wouldn't rely on the shuttle service, it seemed to run too late in the morning and very off schedule during the day for us. Luckily, we had a rental of our own. If you want a hotel that's more like a resort this is not the place to go. I would highly suggest staying on Disney property at the value resorts - $20 or so more a night and you get a much nicer place with a much more magical experience. Also, the fact that they charge a "resort" fee is a little ridiculous, this is by no means a resort, it's basically a Super-8 with a bit fancier of rooms. Now, $6/night isn't a big deal - but it's just more annoying than anything. At it to the room rate, but by no means say it's for amenities. All-in-all, we probably won't go back. Reasons being, lack of updating and non-responsive staff. Not a total deal breaker, and if you can get an amazing deal for a trip that will be spent 90% of the time outside of the hotel - by all means go and stay here. We will likely stay on Disney property again, with all the deals they offer, it's worth an extra $150 or so for the week to get the "magical" vacation experience and no dilapidated hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: TeacherTawny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few minues from Disney where I attended a conference. You will have to rent a car if you need to be anywhere before 9am, as that is the tme of the only shuttle from the hotel. The beds are nice and firm, not too squashy or too hard! The staff is helpful and the breakfast looked good. There are a few places near by to walk to: eating places, rental car places, markets, and "I went to FL and all you got was this T-Shirt" shops. :-) Great place for a family to stop and rest. The lighting in the room is a bit dim for work, but great for watching tv and getting ready for an exciting day at one of the many parks.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "full breakfast" and "fitness center"”
Reviews.Author: heifey
Reviews.Content: All and all, the hotel is ok, but please don't buy the "full hot breakfast" in the description. One of the main reasons we booked this hotel is so we would not have to spend extra for breakfast everyday. This is more of a continental breakfast which is misleading. The hotel was clean and the rooms are pretty nice though. I must admit if we ever travel to Orlando again, we will probably pick another hotel. (Oh, the fitness center consists of a treadmill and a bike!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: lego925
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at the Galleria Palms in july 2011. I stayed there before, but i most likely wont return. Good: location (near I4 and Disney) Rooms (spacious and clean) Cons: They charge a 6$/day resort fees. The hotel is surround by a parking, no one in its right mind could called this hotel a "resort". Why not be honest and add 6$ to the rate. We had no internet connection in the room for the entire week. We were told it may be a router problem and that the connection was available in the lobby. The pillows were probably from the dollar store, but it didnt really matter since the room next to mine was so noisy ( kids running and yelling in the hallway from 8 pm to 2 am) that i didnt sleep the entire week. The pool was nice and clean, but 10 of the 16 chairs were broken. The breakfast area was very dirty. Front desk staff werent friendly. I travel a lot and im pretty easy to please, but with so many cons and so many hotels around orlando, i wont be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK.”
Reviews.Author: KaneKW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel between July 14th and July 21st with my family for Disney World trip, I picked this hotel because they meet my requirements such as free parking, complimentary breakfast and complimentary shuttle bus for theme parks. Overall, this hotel is OK but should be improved. The room is fine, clean but small, the bed is too soft for me. The carpet in hall way area should be replaced because it is dirty but in room is ok. The breakfast was better than nothing, they serve bread, bagel (but not too much), cereals, sausage or biscuit, scramble egg, mini muffins, juice, milk, the coffee was so disappointed, it was so plain, not tasty. They cut the breakfast at 9:00am sharp, the lady who managed the breakfast was not nice. During my stay, my wife and I went to the swimming pool for swimming but after that we got rashes, we thought that they did not do swimming pool sanitation regularly. If you plan to use their pool, just keep it in mind. The hotel is around 25 minutes driving distance from Universal Studio Orlando and about 15 minutes driving distance from Disney World theme park. During my stay, I just use their complimentary shuttle bus service twice because we found that it was much easy to manage our time in theme park. The hotel provides free wifi for internet in room only, so bring your own laptop if you are planning to surf internet during your stay. If you don't bring laptop like me, you have to use their paid service in lobby area, minimum US$5 for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean room, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: rumneyc
Reviews.Content: The room showed some wear and tear, but the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. About the breakfast - it wasn't anything spectacular but there were hot eggs and sausages along with the standard continental breakfast items. The staff should be complemented on attempting to keep the breakfast area stocked while people took huge plates of eggs, sausages, muffins, and toast and then threw half of the food on their plates away. Any breakfast shortages are probably due to your fellow travelers, not by the hotel only putting out limited quantities. We didn't use the pool, but the area looked very well maintained. It is a little difficult to find the street - we found going the long way around to use the light to access the main road worked best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SarahKay8978
Reviews.Content: I am a type A personality, so I totally researched everything to do with our trip to Florida! The hotel was my biggest concern because that can make or break a vacation. After reading the reviews on this hotel compared to others in the same price range or even a little more, this hotel had the best reviews! So I booked it... Everything went smoothly with this hotel from the day we checked in until the day we checked out. Staff was friendly, complimentary breakfast was great. We had biscuits, gravy and eggs 5 out of the 7 days we were there. One day they didn't have the hot stuff out because we were there at 6:30 and they don't get it out until about 7am. One day we went to McDonald's for breakfast because we were on our way to the park and didn't want to wait in line to eat. The eating area did get full quickly, but we always took our stuff out to the pool area and ate there. Great way to start your day! This hotel has such a convenient location, you can't beat it... so close to restaurants (IHOP is actually in the parking lot of the hotel), 1.5 miles to Animal Kingdom, 3 miles to Magic Kingdom, 13 miles to Universal, 15 minutes to shopping center. We also hit the Jungle Golf and played a little mini golf one day which was 5 miles down the road. Everything in our room was pretty clean and functioning. It was great to have a fridge and micro to cut down on our food bills!! The maids cleaned our room everyday. I think 1 day we had to ask, but that's just because they kept seeing us going in and out of the room. Otherwise the service was great! I will stay here again when I go back to Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: tmerritt54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week while visiting Disney. Upon checking in we found ants in our room! I called the front desk. They said they would send someone right up. An hour later still no one showed up. I went down to the front desk and told them again. She asked me if the ants were inside or outsie? I said if they were outside would I care? She then switched us to another room. This room had no hot water in the sink. They said there is no hot water in any sinks. What is the point of having a sink? Also the head board fell off the wall in the middle of the night crashing down on my wife and 5 year old. The next day I had to the help the janitor guy fix it! There was also a problem with the tub. The stopper did not work so you could not take a bath. Also there were a few lights that were burned out. The tv was on the wall crooked. There was tape holding the linning in around the door frame. Bottom line spend a little extra for a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a *** rating”
Reviews.Author: bcmegan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights to do the Disneyland experience. Our room was excellent - we had two queen beds in our room which were very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and clean. There was plenty of storage for our luggage. The parking was free and readily available. The breakfast was very ordinary. The utensils and plates were all disposable and the food variety was poor. The amount of food on offer was very limited and they regularly ran out of everything and were very loath to replenish supplies. The hotel appeared to be full so they should have been refilling the cereals, juices, coffee etc much more often than they did. The dining area was also very small and it was almost impossible to find a vacant and clean table. There was a swimming pool, but we did not use it. The surrounds were very ordinary - I could not see a reason for the resort tax we had to pay. It was convenient to Disney World but there were no decent restaurants within the immediate area - only chain restaurants. There is a laundry which we used. Very small but adequate for our needs. Overall, the hotel was OK for the price but with so much competition around, I had expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: TheFrasiers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were apprehensive about our stay after reading some of the reviews, but we were pleasantly suprised. This is not a five-star hotel, but it's a good value for the price. Rooms were clean. Disney was only minutes away. We would stay here if we return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!.”
Reviews.Author: lwg1848
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not understand (with some of the reviews on this property) what some people expect when they check in to a hotel. The rate on this place is great. Our room was clean and very well decorated and everything worked. The staff were friendly and check in/out was very smooth. Did not do breakfast...we slept in :-) The pool and exterior of the property were great. Many family type restaurants and "touristy" things nearby. I have just booked 2 more nights in the hotel. They have a great Florida resident discount.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaterinaBucharest
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with large rooms, clean and quiet. You can enjoy their swimming pool and there is a supermarket 5 minutes walking, across the 192. The hotel is closed to Disneyland attractions, but be careful with the taxi drivers, you shouldn't pay more than 15-20 USD to any park. Usually the taxi drivers ask you to pay for the park drop off, which stands for 14 USD, but they pay for that once a day, so don't accept or pay partially, no more than 3-5 USD. Be careful with the hotel service, if you ask them to call a partcular taxi company or driver (cheapest ones), they call someone else, based on their connections. The breakfast is not very consistent, but however reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet peaceful place, great staff, no problems...”
Reviews.Author: minisprint
Reviews.Content: Check in went fine, harder to find than I thought since gps took me outa my way. Rooms were clean, staff cleaned our rooms great each day of our stay.. Kids loved the breakfast buffet, they thought it was cool they could keep going back and back..LOL When your in Florida too many people get hung up on quality of rooms, how much time do you actually spend in them. We visited relatives, visited the Kennedy Space Center and put lots miles on our rental car. By the way spend the extra $$ and get the full package at the Space Center its well worth it (lunch w/astronaut)+bus tour.. Liked our stay so much I am returning with son and step son in June.....

Reviews.Title: “If you have a better option, use it!”
Reviews.Author: jayrockafunky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. While the rooms were updated and clean, the service is horrible. They claim to have continental breakfast, however, This is a joke. I went down at 6:30am and 8:00am the second morning. Breakfast was either gone or the breakfast area was so disgusting that you wouldn't want to eat it anyways. I guess overall its an ok hotel, but don't plan on eating in the morning. The other concern I had was the general location of the hotel. Seemed to be a bunch of gang/thug activity within a half mile or so of the hotel. I didn't feel terribly safe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sbsneetch28
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Galleria Palms in Kissimmee. The rooms were clean and modern. The only objection I had was that the hallways seemed a little run-down, and there was construction outside my room during the day (which wasn't really a problem because I was out and about at that time). All in all, it was a pretty great hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Cambodia98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive weekend hotel in Orlando to attend a friends 50th birthday and visit some other friends. The Galleria was perfect. The room was clean, and comfortable. The wireless internet was a definite plus. Due to some health constraints I needed to have a fridge and microwave in the room and it was there, clean and ready for me to use. It was perfect. The staff was very kind, and addressed all of our needs. My husband went for breakfast in the morning, and allowed me to sleep in. It does not get better than that. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families with children. The pool was lovely as well.

Reviews.Title: “way better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: jenniferx173
Reviews.Content: we were excited for the trip but after reading more reviews than my boyfriend did, i will say i was a little nervous. however, the entire experience was way better than we expected. we were able to check in early and the room was exactly as it looked in pictures if not better. unlike some of the other rooms nothing smelled and everything was working perfectly. room had tv, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, 2 sinks in bathroom and one outside, working AC, and strong wifi connection. the maids came in every day and put new sheets on the bed, gave us new towels and straightned up the room. continental breakfast was actually pretty good; i liked the eggs and toast and my boyfriend preferred the sausages and mini muffins. they also had oatmeal, fruit, and juice and coffee. the coffee was served all day, which i liked. we did not find it to be uncomfortably crowded when we went at 8 am and there was still plenty of food as they replace what runs out. the pool was really nice, definitely not heated but we still went in because it was so hot out. it was clean and quiet. when we lost our tv remote we called the front desk and they sent someone up right away to replace it. when that one didn't work, we called again and he was back within 5 minutes. great service. my only issue was with the shuttle which ran at very inconvenient times for what we were looking for and took forever, so we relied on cabs every day which got very expensive because we didnt have a rental car. mears checker cabs are very reliable and relatively cheap (16-18 per way) in comparison, though, and we also used the disney transport system like buses and boats once we got to a park. it was nice to be able to walk to grocery store/shops on the main road, however. lot of things around. overall you get what you pay for and more and i'd recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as precieved on website.”
Reviews.Author: floridatrip777
Reviews.Content: i stayed at "the galleria plams resort" the week of february 17-25 and it was one of my least favorite hotels ever. when we walked into the hotel, and went to our room, it seemed pretty nice until we got ajusted. first, one of the side reading lights was coming out of the wall, and was moving all around. then, the t.v. the first thing i noticed was that the t.v was a vizio t.v, and we had a panasonic remote, and when it didnt work and we called main desk, the man came up, he took the batteries out, and then back in, then turned the t.v back on manually. we didnt get our full enjoyment out of the t.v. the bathroom, it wass nice except for the fact that the fan didnt work, at all. it would turn on but never suck all the steam out from the shower. then the light right next to the shower, and over the right sink, would never turn on when the light switch was flipped. they would both flicker a few times before they would properly turn on. the fitness room was ridiculas. it consisted of a treadmil and an elliptcal. when we walked in, i put my hand on the elliptcal and the batteries fell out. last i checkked, they ran on power cords. and when my father got onto the treadmil and started running, the belt would stop every step he took to a point where he was ruunning and had the power to life the machine completly up and shake it around. the continental breakfast was a very, crowded experience. it is from 6am-9am and when you get down stairs it is completely FULL of people. it was an uncomfortableenviroment to be in, and if you have claustrophobia, i wouldent advise going into the breakkfast space. its full of loud, rambuncious, little children and pushy adults. we walked down around 730am and there was absoulutly no eggs or saugage left. if i was lucky i would have a piece of bread. the breakfast consisted of eggs, sausage, juice, toast, oatmeal, and little fruit. the pool was nice, i must say. and every morning the maids would come in and cleam the rooms. the hotel is located right behind a gift store, where if you walk outside at night, you have the feeling you will be jumped. i did not like the hotel and if you have the oppertunity to stay somewhere else, then go. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: campanologymajor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a decent location, on a strip with a lot of restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were pretty average, it was pretty quiet, the maids cleaned every day providing new towels and toiletries. They also offered free breakfast, although it's probably not the tastiest food in the world. For the frugal hotel goer, free breakfast beats buying IHOP every day, although the hotel is conveniently right next to one. I mean you get what you pay for, it's a lower priced hotel, you get a lower quality room compared to the premium Disney hotels. The hotel conveniently had a shuttle running to Universal, Epcot (which is a monorail/ferry away from Disney World), and Seaworld. That was the best part of the deal, to avoid paying for cabs. The only issue I had with this hotel is the huge cockroach I discovered in the bathroom. On the plus side, the person working at the front desk came up immediately after I called for them to remove it. Overall, it's okay for a cheap stay in Orlando for the average college student or family looking to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mamato3boys
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary when reading the reviews but decided to take a chance. I think that some people are a little to critical but that's just my opinion. The hotel was clean and recently remodeled. The staff was helpful the few times that we needed them. I would highly recommend it to anyone. People need to keep in mind that there are idiots out there making reviews too, or their competition!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good/breakfast dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: snap8405
Reviews.Content: Hotel good, clean. Service at the desk was polite. Breakfast however was very dissapointing. Plate's forks and knives etc. were all plastic. Very limited choice, ervery day the same selection. The number of tables was to small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but No Service”
Reviews.Author: Melkev2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a vacation package to Orlando. Although the rooms were nice the service was almost non-existent. Here is a short list of the pros and cons of this hotel: Pros: 1. Good location, located right near the highway. The drive to Disney World was approximately 5 minutes, and to Universal Studios was about 20 minutes. Perfect if you plan on spending most of your time at the theme parks. 2. Nice rooms which included a fridge and microwave. You could tell the rooms had been updated fairly recently with fairly modern furniture and flat screen television. 3. The maid service was very good. Rooms were always clean and they went to the extra mile to make art out of the towels and kleenex. A nice touch. Cons: 1. The customer service was almost non-existent. The staff ignored you completely unless you approached them. There was never a "hello" or "goodbye" and not even a "how was your stay" or "have a good trip" when you checked out. We don't expect exceptional service from a 3 star hotel but this complete lack of service, or even a hint of friendliness was quite surprising. Be aware of the desk in the lobby which they refer to as "guest services". This was nothing but a thinly veiled front to push timeshare. When you went to speak to them about buying park tickets (which they sell) they would quote you a price and then explain that you would need to go to a breakfast offsite the next morning before you could get the tickets for that price. They would push you to accept, as it appeared the individual was getting a commission. If you told them you were not interested in the "breakfast" and would pay regular prices for the tickets they lost complete interest and did not want to help anymore. They even went so far as to call us in our room the day after we checked in to let us know of a free "welcome gift" which we could pick up. This of course gave them an opportunity to pitch the time share. The gift, which we saw them give to others, was a bag of microwave popcorn. We were very disappointed that a hotel would be this deceptive and pretend this was actually a guest services desk. 2. The shuttle to the parks: Fortunately we had rented a car but those who intend to rely on the shuttle should be aware that it only goes to Disney World twice each morning and once to Universal Studios. 3. The breakfast was extremely limited, even for one that is free. The first day when we got there well before the breakfast was to end they informed us that they had run out of bread for toast. Fortunately, there are lots of places nearby for breakfast, including Denny's. 4. While the rooms seem to have been updated fairly recently, the same obviously has not been done for the common areas of the hotel. There are lots of other hotels in the area for a similar price. Next time we would probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern looking rooms for budget friendly Orlando trip”
Reviews.Author: lindsluvorlando
Reviews.Content: This hotel is defintely "fine". Simply put that is it. It is not exceptionally comfortable, the breakfast is okay if you avoid the eggs and sausage gravy, and the staff is just pretty average. No frills for sure. The location is great being in close proximity to Disney, but it is on a pretty busy strip of tacky tourist shops. In fact the best way to find this place is to look for the enormous mermaid. The place itself has a nice neutral decor and decent TV in the room(but with few channels). In all it is a great value for such a clean place. The beds have a decent pillow top, but its hard to beat my memory foam mattress at home. Bring your own pillows unless you like mile high plush ones. ( my neck is out of whack now) Beware that both Friday and Saturday morning trash pick up was in the 7 o clock hour and the dumpster crashing is very jarring if you are sleeping in. The fridge is barely cold (and not adjustable) and the wall unit AC really never gets the room really cool, but we just kept knocking it down into the 60's. We have stayed before and it is definitely "just average", but being on a budget, it works.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't overpromise but still could be better”
Reviews.Author: Fishbone0701
Reviews.Content: They definitely don't promise something is not there but for some reason you leave unimpressed. The in room fridge never was cold, the cooktop in the room was non functioning, and an in wall ac unit in a hotel now a days. Breakfast wasn't impressive and when called down for more towels since they only gave us two when I stated there were four guests, they asked us to come to the front desk to get them. However, reasonably priced, good location and I have stayed in much worse for more $$$.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: Redskinrex
Reviews.Content: If I told you how much my family and I liked this place, you'd take all of the rooms and there wouldn't be any availability when we wanted to stay there, so I'm not going to let you know about this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE ROOM CONDITIONS”
Reviews.Author: vaxine
Reviews.Content: The rooms presents very unsafe conditions for young kids. On one of the days my 5 yr old daughter rolled from her bed and hit her head on the protruding base of the other bed. We ended up taking her to the emergency department resulting in laceration on face. The bases of beds have broken joints in the middle which have very sharp edges and unsafe for kids playing on the carpet or between the beds. The management refused to take responsibility ( not unusual in these cases). More than likely I will proceed with negligence proceedings against the hotel. Also the hotel rooms are actually condos with seperate owners for each room.. The manager told me that. Please stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Sparty64
Reviews.Content: We stayed December 28 - January 1, 2011 We paid $59.99 for our room and that included the $5.00 resort fee -- still not sure what that is for....however we were very pleased with our room and the breakfast was very good and always very hot. Coffee is provided all day. I needed an envelope and they gave me one at the front desk everyone seemed very helpful the rooms were very quiet at night did not hear hall noise. we were on the third floor and were able to see some of the fireworks from Disney. I would stay again. however if you need wifi and want to be in your room it doesn't work real well so you would need to sit in the lobby if you don't bring a laptop to use thier's is pretty pricey. It is not provided free.

Reviews.Title: “Met Basic Needs”
Reviews.Author: imsupafly
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for an overnight stay since we were visiting Discovery Cove while vacationing in St. Pete Beach and didn't want to have to wake up way early for an otherwise two hour drive. Location was slightly odd within a business park behind a busy strip of souvenir shops and restaurants, but close highway access once you maneveur the one-ways and U-turns. Room was clean, it probably was modern at one point but now carpet stains, dented dark wood furniture, broken table and bedside lamps really show the lack of upkeep. The room was really dark and sconces that seemed to be installed as an afterthought did little to brighten the room. Double bathroom sinks was nice to have, showerhead didn't provide good spray coverage. Beds were decent but the pillows were overstuffed and lumpy without alternative pillows, making you bend your neck uncomfortably. Positives were in room wifi which was fast with no connection problems, and breakfast which makes getting up in the morning before heading out to the parks a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Orlando Theme Park location”
Reviews.Author: Fav4
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, enough room for 4 of us. Included breakfast buffet was very good, we stayed for 15 nights and although it the items were similar everyday with the hot items alternating every 2 days, there was still enough variety. The in-room fridge was a good size and kept lunch items (and beer) cold. Only one complaint and that is the lighting, the rooms are quite dark and one of our bedside lights was broken and was not repaired during our stay (the front desk made note of the repair required but it was never done). Location is great, within 10 minutes to WDW and 20-30 minutes to Universal, Seaworld etc. Would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: lilbee1125
Reviews.Content: To start, we checked in late on Thursday (12/09/10) and had the worst check-in experience I've ever had at a hotel. The person at the front desk was an asian male that was so rude(I dont remember his name, but please see attached a picture we took of him) it really ruined the rest of our stay. We had originally reserved 2 King rooms, and upon check-in he told us there was only one king room (# 514) and one double available (room #403). We were ofcourse upset, because the rate we had paid was for 2 king rooms. He told us that the rooms arent guaranteed, even though we paid a higher rate for a king room. We then said that wasn't fair and that we should have been notified that we werent going to be given two king rooms ahead of time. This person simply shrugged his shoulders and in a very rude manner said "well you can cancel and go some where else if you want, but I cant help you". Needless to say we took the rooms he had available because, where else were we going to go at almost 1am? The next morning I asked to speak with a manager, I think her name was Catalina or Carolina? She is a hispanic young woman, with long black hair. I expressed my concerns and discontent with the person at checkin, and she was very nice and apologized and assured us that we would have another king room available to us in the afternoon. She said she was going to leave a note a the desk and she was going to hold room 517. All we had to do was pick up the keys when we got back from Animal Kingdom. As I predicted, when we got back to the hotel around 7pm, Michael at the front desk had no idea we were supposed to move to room 517 and notified us that it had already been sold to someone else. He called the manager "catalina" and offered to "comp" one of the nights in exchange for having to settle for a double room. We accepted because at that point, we only had 2 nights left and wanted to unpack our things already! He was very nice, but the point is that yet AGAIN we were not given what we were promised and it totally ruined our experience at the Galleria Palms. Upon checkout, Michael at the front desk had indeed credited one night for the double room. The problem is that he credited the cheapest night !!! Which isnt fair and we had a little dispute that it should have been the average rate of all the nights. He finally agreed and we got the credit, but once again there was another issue and another technicality. It was just TERRIBLE. In addition: The included "breakfast" was nothing as advertised. At the front desk there was a sign that showed all the different menu items that would be available and in actuality less than half the things on there were actually given. Part of the reason why we chose this hotel was the value, and the extra ammenities offered (breakfast, free shuttle to parks, king room). Sadly we could attain only a small part of those ammenities. The free shuttle was either too early every day, or too late. We were only able to take it once, and had to wait almost an hour in the lobby for it. This needs to be worked on. Overall, the rooms were clean, very nicely decorated and it still was a great price/value. However, we will NEVER stay here again. I'd rather pay a little bit more and be treated well and actually given the things that are promised in the advertisement of the hotel. I don't go on vacation to have to deal with headaches and rude people that shouldn't be working in the hospitality industry to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “modern”
Reviews.Author: Naperbecker
Reviews.Content: Nice modern room with wall mounted tv. Pool area was small. Continental breakfast was better than most I've been too. Close to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: Katiec95
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed one night as a layover to our cruise. The location was great since it was right off the main drag for Orlando attractions (I.e. Disney & Universal). The hotel was modest in size, but the rooms were clean, up-to-date and quiet. The swimming pool was a bit small, but there did not seem to be many people swimming anyway. The full comp breakfast in the morning was well worth the stay. My family and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value for the money and super clean!”
Reviews.Author: srjk35
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and viewed the photo of the room. I thought it was very nice, when I called to make the reservation I asked if the room would like the the one online. They confirmed it would and it did, so I was pleased. I did read a review on here that stated some rooms had Disney views and I asked for this room, they said I had it but I did not see Disney. Morning breakfast was enough to get you through to lunch. I also read here about the person who would approach you about the parking pass and it being an intro into trying to get you to sit for a timeshare, so I was prepared when she approached which was great! Bath was clean, towels nice, beds great we all noticed a well nights sleep, we had a problem with the TV remote and someone was to the room within 5 minutes. I didnt use the pool but it looked clean, not real big. I paid $49 dollars for this room when reserving they tried to increase it by $10 for the weekend nights but I expressed some displeasure with that and they honored the $49. We felt it was a great value for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: xavier16
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights using Hotwire for $25/night plus taxes over the Labor Day weekend. For what we paid, it was really really good value. The hotel has a resort fee of $5/night which is not too bad. location is in Kissimmee, a little far from Universal Studios (which is where we were headed) but it was rather close to Disney parks. Since we had a car with us, this was really not a problem. The area is okay, with lots of cheap food options in the vicinity. Lobby looked poor and old but the rooms were more than satisfactory. Rooms were in the large side and had large beds. Bathroom was clean. I loved that it had a refrigerator in the room and microwave which we used a lot since we brought some food with us. The room was overall clean and presentable but the carpets had a few stains on them and did not look that clean. They also had a big flat screen TV. They also had free internet. They also served breakfast which was not bad- they had boiled eggs, biscuits, bagels, bread, cereals, donuts, and muffins. Not too many choices but still glad since it was free! I think overall it was a pleasant stay. I would stay there again if we had the same deal that we got from Hotwire. I probably would not want to pay the full price though. Nothing wrong with the hotel but as there are so many options in Orlando/Kissimmee, this will not be my first choice if I paid their full price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Neilb62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found the Hotel friendly and efficient. We actually just turned up 3 days early after abandoning a trip to the coast and they took us in without hesitation, extending our booking for us, and even gave us a room upgrade! Sorted! Breakfast can be a bit manic, as with most Hotels of this type the breakfast room is small and gets crowded. Breakfast is a buffet affair with sausage, scrambled egg, cereal, biscuits etc etc. Good clean pool, large comfy rooms, laundry, free Wi-Fi throughout and a PC in the breakfast room for public use. Also there is a tourist info point with tickets for the parks and a bus that picks up at the Hotel to drop off at the theme parks. All in all very good, well situated with plenty of evening eating within a short walk. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Disney area”
Reviews.Author: FruOlsson
Reviews.Content: Quick, friendly check-in at the front desk. Nice, clean modern (however small) room with large bathroom and good water pressure in shower. I had to store a few of my suitcases underneath the two sinks in the bathroom! Free breakfast with a couple of hot items was served every morning without any varity all week long. They kept running out of eggs and sausage the whole time but it was still nice to eat something before heading out.The breakfast area was crowded and I missed extra seating like a patio or a few chairs to sit and have breakfast at by the pool. Galleria Palms served their guests coffee all day long which I thought was a nice gesture! All the familiar restaurants like Golden Corral, Taco Bell, Ponderosa etc are within walking distance in the neighborhood. The kids liked all the miniature golf courses close by and the many souvenir shops with Florida knick-knacks! The Galleria Palms is a great place to stay if visiting the parks no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money, super location, near bus route to shopping.”
Reviews.Author: BorninBC
Reviews.Content: My husband and 19-year-old daughter and I stayed at the Galleria Palms in June while we visited Disney World, Universal, etc. The service was excellent, rooms were clean and outfitted with a small fridge and microwave and housekeeping was great. The hotel was quiet and the beds were comfortable. There was a small supermarket and liquor store right across the street, and many restaurants within a five minute walk-Black Angus was by far the best. Galleria Palms was a one minute walk to a bus route just in front of IHOP on 192 (#55 bus-go online for the schedule (lynx) $2.00 each way or $4.50 for an all-day pass) that took us to a Super Walmart and a Super Target; two excellent places to go for reasonable shopping and grocery items. We purchased a lot of food at these two places because we personally don't like to eat out a lot and the free breakfast at the hotel was the same each day. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the theme parks, (you can transfer to any of the other parks via the transportation center at Disney-Disney buses, boats or the monorail will take you where you want to go) but the time between drop-off and pick-up at the theme parks is somewhat long. Because of that, we met up with a great taxi driver named Habib Aboutayeb, who provides a flat-rate taxi service to and from Orlando Airport, the theme parks, and wherever else you want to go. He was, by far, the most reasonable and knowledgeable taxi driver we have ever had the pleasure of meeting. He knows the area very well and was most helpful to us during our visit. Kissimmee is approximately 30 minutes from the Orlando Airport, and if you don't rent a car-funnily enough it can cost more for a car rental than to take a taxi to the theme parks and back-he is by far, your best bet. His number is: 407-408-0439. He can also be reached via email for reservations: m.moha14@yahoo.com The front desk clerk is more than happy to contact him for you if need be. Kissimmee is a very hot and humid place in summer. We all managed to get heatstroke while visiting, so be sure to drink lots of water and Gatorade (you can take your own non-alcoholic drinks into Disney Parks and Universal) and although you may not feel like eating, be sure to eat a lot of small meals throughout the day. Enjoy the pool at the hotel; it is bound to rejuvenate you after a long day at the Parks. For those purchasing tickets to Disneyworld, save your money and don't get the parkhopper ticket-you can basically plan to spend one day at each park- we bought a 7-day parkhopper and it took us 4 1/2 days to visit Epcot, Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom (Tusker House Restaurant was phenomenal!) and Hollywood Studios- we hit a park a day. You may need extra time if you have younger children or visit at peak season. Don't worry about getting wet on the rides-you will want to get wet because it is so hot!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to all parks!”
Reviews.Author: FLPylot
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, everything was ready for us and the room was cool. The rooms have been recently remodeled and upgraded and the furnishings were as good as any comparable hotel. Two vanities and a wet bar were nice with 4 of us in the room. The free continental breakfast was a nice start to a busy morning. The free wireless internet was a little spotty and slow, but I had no trouble connecting when I need some quick information. There is also a "rental" computer in the lobby. The pool was clean and there were pool towels provided for us on the pool deck. One day, we accidentally left the door slightly ajar and a hotel employee knocked on the door to let us know. That is a sign of quality management and a well trained staff. All staff were attentive and very helpful when we need to send/receive a fax, receive a UPS shipment and get an extra towel. There were also many eating options within walking or a short drive. Definitely check this out. Disney within 5 minutes and Sea World within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Cataylor1987
Reviews.Content: Employees are helpful and nice. Hotel is clean and has a contemporary style. We had a room on the 5th floor facing Disney World and were able to watch fireworks from our room every night. Breakfast is not much and ends at 9 am and pillows were very firm. Overall we had a great time! This was our second stay at that hotel and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JaxMK
Reviews.Content: Before going to Orlando I read reviews about this hotel and was worried about what we would find... however, I have to say that everything bad I had read was wrong. If you just want somewhere fairly cheap to stay near the theme parks and close to shops and restaurants, but with excellent service and gorgeous rooms, then this is the place to come. From the moment we checked in nothing was too much trouble for the staff, particularly the reception staff who did everything they could to accommodate our requests, even ringing Sea World for us to check on their opening hours...! Yes the public areas of this hotel are a bit tired, and yes the sign has been redone outside and yes, I can imagine that in peak season the eating area for the buffet breakfast would get very crowded. But this wasn't a problem for us in February. As for the swimming pool being near the car park, who cares?? It's fenced, with plants all around the fence, and the hotel is in a quiet area off the main road anyway. The breakfast was plentiful, and let's not forget folks, it's free... the room we had was fabulous, with huge beds with memory foam toppers, loads of pillows, black out curtains and air conditioning. The little kitchen area had a full size fridge, microwave and coffee maker that doubled as a kettle for us British tea lovers, and a sink. The room was clean, serviced every day and very comfortable. I really have nothing bad to say about the Galleria Palms... so please ignore these reviews and go yourself. Next time I'm in Orlando, this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Pillows did me in”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED (qualified): Orlando has number <$100 hotels, many with independent owners with a single property, the Galleria is one of those. Disney area hotels also suffer with high occupancy rooms (families) for long durations (a week), banging around in a small room. Add in the high humidity and maintenance for any hotel in this area is a constant nightmare. The Galleria sits just back from the main road and might be hard to find. It's a classic multistory single hallway building. It's located in an area full of trashy gift shops and fast food choices. Generally in good repair, long hallways are cooled with a single A/C unit so I can imagine the heat in the summer. The hotel was almost empty on my 1 night stay and check-in was fine, though somewhat disorganized. The $5 resort fee is sadly common considering this is by no means a 'resort' but illustrative of the owner's attempt to increase margins (advertise a lower rate, but charge more). Rooms were in good standing and as the photos others have posted. Room lighting is a bit dim overall, but adequate, Bathroom was clean and OK for illumination. Toiletries are bare minimum, so bring your own. The free wireless Internet basically does not work from the room and I ended up going to the lobby. The biggest room negative was the foam pillows, I awoke in the middle of the night with a stiff neck and ended up sleeping with no pillow. There is no workable desk area in the room. SUMMARY: I probably can't recommend this property for a business trip (no desk and no Internet). I struggle on my family vacation recommendation, the small pool is nothing special for kids and the hotel location is not on the beaten bath. I would recommend properties on Hotel Plaza Blvd closer to Downtown Disney. The poor pillows seems to be a deal killer. Nonetheless, if you get stuck here, the stay isn't unpleasant or poor, there are simply just better choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lissete
Reviews.Content: Many times, when I book a hotel, the photos on the website are a far cry from what you actually get. This was not the case at the Galleria Palms. Our room looked exactly like the photos on the hotel website. The rooms are nicely decorated, warm & inviting. It was also spotless. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean & crisp. I loved that the room had a micro and a fridge. Free Wi-Fi is a huge plus! The location is perfect for visiting the parks. If I have to stay outside of Disney, I would not hesitate to stay here again. Parking is ample and they offer a shuttle to the parks. The schedule is very limited and the times are a bit inconvenient, but if you do not have a car, it helps. There are also many restaurants in the area. The hotel is set back from the main road, so traffic noise is not a problem. The one & only negatiive is the breakfast. Not the quality. It's free, and contains a couple of hot items so we can't complain. Breakfast ends at EXACTLY 9AM. My husband was literally trying to serve himself and the staff was removing stuff. I arrived at 9:04 and everything was completely cleared away. Many guests were just getting up since we had just "sprung forward" (DST). We watched guest after guest show up and not have anything available to eat. A more reasonable end time would be 10 AM as is the case in most other places. It also does not help that no one mentioned breakfast or the hours at check in.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL... LOOK JUST LIKE PHOTO! PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: neda1956
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the galleria palms 03-5-2010 upon arrival the outside looked nice. But when I entered into my room I have to admit I was very Happy and shocked. The photo that they show of the rooms look exactly the same. Everything was nicley decorated and very upscale /modern.. the bathroom was so clean and shiny you could eat of the counter top.... my boyfriend and I was so greatful that we picked this hotel and the price was very reasonable. 2 days for only 150.00... and the brekfast was very good especially the fruit salad.. everything was fresh.. Good job will def stay again

Reviews.Title: “We will go back. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: yendys85
Reviews.Content: We were only staying for one night and didn't want to spend a fortune on a room, also didn't want to stay in questionable facilities though. This hotel was perfect for us and was exactly what we wanted. Our room (2 bed famliy suite) looked just like the pictures on their site. It was clean and extremely comfortable. I thought the furniture looked new and contemporary but I can see how their large size in the small room could be an issue if you had a large family staying instead of just the 2 of us. The bathroom was very clean and the shower was quite nice, the water pressure was extremely relaxing after a long day at Disney. The location was a bit difficult to find at first and we ended up driving right by it, however once we did get there we were amazed at how close we were to WDW. (Right off the interstate exit behind an IHOP) We usually stay at an Inn & Suites on International Drive (also quite nice, just pricier), but I think this is our new Orlando hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: deejamm
Reviews.Content: We brought our 12 year old daughter to Disney. Was a good location-easy to get to Disney. Clean hotel and clean rooms. If you are looking for fancy, this is not it. But it is a good value for your money. No restaurants/bar on site but plenty within walking distance. Only complaints we had were with the water pressure in the shower- a little too light for my comfort and getting calls in the morning about buying park tickets. That was annoying but it only happened two mornings. Good breakfast, although the same thing every morning- eggs, sausage, toast... juice, coffee. Also the "gym" is only 1 treadmill and 1 bike. We enjoyed our stay and felt that the staff was friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ALTERNATIVE TO HIGH-PRICED RESORTS”
Reviews.Author: PROF_CONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Galleria Palms instead of a high-priced resort which had a conference that I attended. The Galleria Palms had excellent updated rooms with flat screen TVs and refrigerator and microwave. I was surprised at the total room upgrades for the price. Very clean and it included a decent continental breakfast which was served 6-9AM but the eggs and sausage were served after 7AM because most of the people did not get up early (like we did). Was decent, but don't expect the spread you find at the Grand Hyatt or a Four Seasons. If you want to eat like a horse there are several buffets very close including a Golden Corral. All and all, great location not only from the conference resorts but from Disney World as well. Would definitely stay there again next year. The restaurant next door (WILDSIDE) was excellent and decently priced. While I was there, I recommended the hotel to a friend who was coming down the next day and he said thanks for the great recommendation after the conference. The money we saved, wife and I went to DisneyWorld for a day, also attended a birthday party, and still had money to spare compared to the resort. If I go to the conference next year - I will be getting a room at the Galleria Palms again. It is just off 192 (half block).

Reviews.Title: “Never Again....”
Reviews.Author: FishingbigM
Reviews.Content: I had one of the most terrible experiences with this hotel that I have ever had. I negotiated a deal prior to my arrival of what was going to be a two night stay with my wife. First of all, the hotel is OLD and RUNDOWN. It has been several different brand hotels in the past. The parking lot needs to be re-paved. There is VERY POOR lighting in the parking lot at night (although that's great for thieves. They like it nice and dark). They actually have a banner covering up the name of the last hotel. Very hard to see, especially at night. But what ruined it for me was the bait-and-switch trick they used on me. I had negotiated a deal for one room with a king bed for two nights, and got confirmation. Upon arrival, I was told for the price I got I could not get the king bed, I get double beds. The king bed would cost me an additonal $10 per night (plus the additional taxes) . After several minutes of conversation, they basically called me a liar, would not budge on the deal, and let us walk out the door over $20. Not too smart considering they are only running 62% occupancy. We got our credti card re-imbersed, walked across the street, a got another room for two nights. After thinking about my decision for a couple of days, I have concluded I made the right decision by leaving. Can't imagine what might have happend should I have had any problems during our stay. It's just and old hotel that has passed it's prime and needs complete renovation. The price might be good, but you get what you pay for - old nasty hotel and poor service. Be forwarned.........

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: Niels1984
Reviews.Content: I would like to advise everyone to NOT GO to this cheap hotel. Ok, the stay is cheap but the stay is also terrible! The breakfast was served on polystyrene plates and we had to eat with plastick forks and knifes. The locations is next to the high way and you have to take a taxi to Disney World ($25,-)... So, so sad that we have not chosen for a Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: arisha-hamzah
Reviews.Content: Very close to Disney parks. Lots of space for car parking. Reasonable breakfast. Comfortable bed and pillows. Good quality picture on flat TV with many channels. Daily cleaning and bed preparation. No disturbance by ticket seller. Lots of restaurants and stores near by. Room as shown on hotel website. Two negatives: On 31st morning, more people for breakfast than the hotel could have handled them easily. Not enough stuff for everyone. 2nd, the fridge was too old and not cooling enough. Overall, best value hotel that i booked after lots of research and i am satisfied with the result.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great rates.”
Reviews.Author: khendric1
Reviews.Content: Our first time here and thought it was awesome. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We will definitely be staying here again and would recommend it highly. Good location and b reakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY.”
Reviews.Author: ITSMERAY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two teenage daughters. The hotel is just what I expected and more. Clean easy to get too and the staff at the front desk where extremely helpful. I would definitely be staying here again and again. The pool was great we had a great time not only while on vacation but the time we spent in the hotel. If you want a great place to stay and a great deal than visit the Galleria Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tutwilerjr
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd trip to the land of the mouse and the first time we've stayed at this hotel. It is however the nicest hotel we've stayed in and that includes some of the nicer hotels in the area, such as the Ramada. The wife and I figure that money should be spent in the attractions and not in a hotel we will only spend our time sleeping in for the most part. Hit's are good location off of 192 and therefore 10 minutes max driving to the Disney Parks. Breakfast is just ok. Nothing great, but I've had far worse. They should spring for some waffle makers to go along with the biscuits/gravy, eggs, sausage and of course the usual pastries. 4 kinds of juice, coffee, tea, cereal and some canned fruit pretty much describe it. Not bad really. Does get old after a few days. Pool is quite small and nothing special as it is located right next to the parking lot. Different restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance are the IHOP (right out front) and the New York Pizza World (very very good pizza) and Colorado House of Beef (not bad, not great). Lobbies are hot and not airconditioned past the lobby floor. Rooms are quite large (300 square feet), with very good beds and external airconditioners that are quiet. Pillows are those typical very thick foam pillows that work great for setting up in bed, but lousy for sleeping. We brought our own. very nice 32" flat screen TV. Hair Dryer, ironing board, small table and two chairs (we stayed in the regular 2 queen room). Microwave and frig. What else, shower worked fine. two different sinks in the bathroom. Towels were good (not great). One very high mark is clean. The rooms are cleaned up by the maids to a very high degree every day. I mean, they wet mop the bathroom and tile areas every single day. We also had no problem with soaps and lotions/shampoo like others. Guess that's it. Bottom line is we would certainly stay again. PS. They did try to push you to buy theme park tickets downstairs, but they were nice about it. We told them we already had our tickets and that subject was over pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome For The Price Would Stay Many More Times!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetie8291985
Reviews.Content: My experience here was awesome. I will give my pros and cons and try and address in my experience some of the concerns placed here. Overall the hotel was perfect for our needs.
