Great price as well!!! I went for 7 days for my honeymoon. I am probably considered crazy by friends and family when it comes to hotel cleanliness. I am terrified of hotel showers and beds. The room was amazingly clean. It passed in my book. The room was perfect for our stay. The size was just right. The only flaws I would have to say would have been the lack of concern for our towels and the pool. Being that we were on our honeymoon (and that I have a worry wart for a mother that has passed certain traits on to me) we kept the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door the whole time. One, obvious we were on our honeymoon and two being that we were going to be park hopping I didn't want to carry around a huge purse all day. So I would leave my purse that had belongings or information that I wouldn't want disturbed. Not to say that anyone would steal, you just have to be really careful now a days. We would call every other day for towels and the staff really weren't too helpful with getting us that stuff. It was even mentioned that if we took our "Do Not Disturb" sign down that we would have an easier time getting them. Now as for the pool, it was very small and located in the parking lot, but if you are parking all day long it doesn't matter. We never went to the pool and could have cared less about it. Those are the only two complaints I have and they really don't matter because the price and location are amazing!! To address on my experiences with some of the concerns I have read on this site with the hotel are; the halls being hot, the entrance to the hotel, timeshare sharks and the showers getting hot. As far as the halls being hot, I didn't care. They were hot, but we had a nice working air conditioner (worked VERY well) in our room. The entrance is extremely hidden. Thanks to Trip Advisor I already new this going in and had no trouble locating the hotel, but I can def. see where that would be a HUGE problem for some people. We never experienced any timeshare sharks we did however on the first day get rushed about buying our tickets (that we had already purchased). The man wouldn't stop talking but we got away and found a side door and never saw them again. Don't let this bother you, because in MOST of the gift shops and restaurants there were the same people set up doing the samething. You are going to encounter that almost everywhere it seemed for us. My husband would be very upset with me if I didn't address the shower. The shower was hard to work and did not get very hot at all!! He was very disappointed by this. Some days were fine and other days you would wait for it to heat up for what seemed like 15 minutes and it just wouldn't get very hot at all. Overall after weighing the pros and cons of this hotel I would stay again and again. For the price you think you are going to get a roach motel and it is quite the opposite. I loved it! The pictures on the site are very true to our experience. Our room looked just like the pictures and I was very pleased!! This is a great hotel that should be considered any and every time you are going to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianThousandOaks_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Oct 1-4 (Thu-Sun). The price was $49 a night, which appeared to not be a special (even the hotel site offered that price). Included in that rate was a morning breakfast every day. The selection was meager, with sausage and scrambled eggs as the only cooked items, but how can anyone complain when it is free? My 4th floor room was quiet, clean and comfortable. It came with a plasma TV, free Wi-Fi, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, and hair dryer. These are unheard of at a $50 hotel. Parking was free, and the hotel allows cancellations up to 48 hours in advance with full refund. Again - unheard of in 2009. I checked in at 2pm and got my key at the front desk with no speech (others have claimed a 10 minute timeshare type speech). My only issue with the room was that the marble floor tiles in the bathroom are very slippery, even when not wet. Also, the elevators are really, really slow. I did not check out the pool at all. I have stayed at Orlando hotels that were rated 2 stars higher than this, but were not nearly as nice as this. They should be charging at least $75 a night for this place. Location is very good; you are 5 minutes away from Disney Hollywood Studios, 10 minutes from Sea World, and 15 minutes from Universal. No toll charges to get to any of these from the hotel. Hotel itself is very hard to fins because it has a temporary sign. From the road, look for the big blue trinket shop with the giant mermaid on the front. You'll know it when you see it. The hotel is right behind it. Let the mermaid be your guide...

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at an average price”
Reviews.Author: Granolla
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was average in cleanliness and amenities. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. We chose this hotel for the good reviews and because they had a shuttle service to Disney. The shuttle was free but the park closed at 7:00 and the shuttle didn't pick us up until close to 9:00 - it would have been worth the parking fee to drive ourselves. The only other issue we had at the hotel was the staff at breakfast were rationing the food - the employee was serving the eggs and sausage and would not give me more when I asked - quite rude. The kids did swim in the pool which was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: koa2469
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate and well maintained. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Best price is actually at their website. Would come from amusement parks to find room cleaned and restocked with fresh towels. Would definitely return. Read other reviews and I was not subjected to harrasing timesharing vultures. My stay was quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: dkmanc
Reviews.Content: Don't think you are going to get a discount on Disney Tickets at this hotel unless you like to waste about 2 hours of your vacation listening about purchasing a time share. Other than that, the hotel was clean the front desk was very nice and the beds were very comfortable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Shell143
Reviews.Content: Our Family of 4, mom, dad, 9 yr old and 2 yr old sons. We made our reservation, however when we arrived it was not the "King Bed" that was stated in the reservation, it was the 2 double beds. They didn't do anything about that. We co-sleep with our 2 yr old and the queen bed was a bit too close. Beds are super soft, lots of pillows. There is not a wet bar in the room as stated on their website nor is the toiletries from bath and body works. What you get is a 1 inch round face soap, 1 small hotel bar soap, 1 small bottle of shampoo, 1 bottle of lotion. Bring your own. Not enough for a family to wash with for 2 days. The bathroom floor was full of long black hair, and toothpaste dried up on the wall paper, mold was starting to form in the shower grout. All of this could of been cleaned up using a toothbrush, I did try it w/ a rag without a problem. Bathroom does have 2 sinks inside it. Which was nice. Water very hot and lots of pressure. In the room, the fridge made a noise all night, but that was on our 2nd night and it was 10pm so we slept through it. Can't control the temp or turn it off on our own. A bed light was burned out upon arrival, no tv guide, or any type of "instructions" in the room like time of breakfast, time pool is open and closed, etc...just a tour book on the local disney park and a menu for room service from outside places. It was quiet, no outside noise from your window. There was a sink in the room, however water didn't come out of it, not sure what that was for. Check in was simple, no one told us to get a parking permit or sent us to the person at the "buy your theme park tickets here booth". We didn't bother with the free breakfast, it is over at 9am. But there are plenty of all you can eat for 3.99 breakfast coupons to be found for the local restaurants. Also there is a cracker barrel down the road, or chick fl a, or mc donalds or burger king. Super target is near as well as a Publix and cici's pizza. Lots of survivors shops and mini golf nearby. It is a bit hard to locate this hotel. The hallways are hot, but that is understandable, who wants to pay to cool the halls. The ice machine worked, however, coke machines on 1st and 2nd floors did not work, don't know about 3rd and 4th floors. there are 2 elevators, and it takes a few minutes to wait for one. Pool was nice, 3-5ft deep, and there are changing color lights in the pool under the water that is pretty cool for the kids. OH< just so you know, pool closes at 10pm. There are side doors you can use to enter the building you don't have to go through the lobby, you need your room card to access through the side doors. We paid 54.00 a night. Which is a wonderful price for the area. We live just 90 min away from orlando and have been at several hotels in this area over the past 20 years. We have stayed at higher end hotels and lower end hotels. If you need a room to sleep while your busy at the parks or for a convention or job, this is the place for you. No game room or fitness rooms, just nice rooms. Also on our second day the room was not cleaned until 3:30pm. We were gone from 9am - noon and then to the pool for a few hours, so it was a bit disappointing to come back from that all day to a dirty room with no clean towels. When the maid did come, she just made the bed and moped quick and wiped down the bathroom, empty trash, and left clean towels. Only a 10 min top job so why it took till 3:30 pm I will never know. I think there is free wi-fi, but the one and only computer with internet for guests is next to the guy selling the tickets booth and they charge .50 cents per each page you view online! I wasn't paying for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Parks~!”
Reviews.Author: sandy_flipflops
Reviews.Content: This was a FANTASTIC deal for our needs. Absolutely perfect. We were hoping to get a clean quiet room with no frills for under $50 to use as a home base to see Disney and Sea World. What we got far exceeded our expectations. Some of the past reviews mentioned the time-share vultures needed to get a parking pass. This was not our experience. I wonder if they discontinued that practice due to complaints. There was a time-share guy at a desk in the breakfast area, but he stayed in his cage and didn't bother anyone during the 4 days we were there. The HOTEL is set a little back from 192-Irlo Brosnan. Very quiet. No road noise or commotion. Super close to the Disney Parks. The hotel is about 1 mile from the park road system. You don't even have to get on I-4. Sea World is about 5 miles North on I-4. The ROOM was fantastic! Very stylish contemporary with lots of thought put into the set-up. Tall cupboard to hang dresses and pants with a set of drawers inside. Plenty of drawers in closet and dresser to unpack all of your clothes and traveling needs. Small cupboard under microwave to organize/store any of your food, plates, etc. Comes with a nice microwave and refrigerator. Counter in room is granite. BATHROOM has marble floors and granite counters. Very nice size. Nice shampoo, conditioner and face soap. Although they NEVER replenished them. Housekeeping seemed a bit passive-aggressive, but they did keep the room nice and clean. There is a bit of difference between the queen rooms and the king rooms. QUEEN rooms are typical. KING room has a little section with a small couch and table. Try not to get the first floor. It has a granite floor, which makes the hall noise echo loudly from people going to the elevator. Great free wifi - iron - ironing board - hair dryer - swimming pool. Lots of restaurants and cheesy gift shops close by Free shuttle to and from the parks at scheduled times BREAKFAST - Much better than "expanded" continental breakfasts at most hotels. I would call it a full breakfast. Fair, but good enough fuel to avoid a stop at a restaurant. Scrambled eggs - scrambled eggs with sausage mixed in - pancakes (horrible) - biscuits and gravy - assorted sweet rolls and cakes - fruit loops - wheat flakes - bread (toaster available) - juice machine (orange, apple, punch) - coffee - tea - apples - canned peach slices. POOL is situated in such a way that it doesn't draw one in to relax and sit around for the day. Kind of wedged in between the parking lot and building with little folliage. GOOD: fantastic rooms with microwave & frige - close to Disney parks - free breakfast - free wifi BAD: Breakfast room tables never cleaned off throughout breakfast, so you have to use a dirty table if you are not there first. UGLY: No replenishment of shampoo or soap

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Theniffny
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a great price! It's in the middle of everything, the beds are very comfortable and the room was spotless; BUT, as soon as you step out of your room the staff is useless and the timeshare sharks are constantly circling the lobby! I had no shampoo in my room and after asking the front desk four times (in person) I just went to the gas station and bought some. Don't ask for any recommendations from the front desk, they just send you to the sales desk and send you to some crappy place that pays them to do so... Stay at this hotel understanding that it is what it is - A great deal on a comfortable clean room in a great location (anything beyond that, you're on your own!)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Rooms - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jmb84
Reviews.Content: We would definitely not hesitate to stay here again. We booked directly throught the hotels website and got a room with 2 queen beds. It was 2 adults and a 9 year old child and the room and bathroom had plenty of room. We stayed 3 nights while visiting Magic Kingdom and Discovery Cove. The hotel was very convenient to the theme parks. The street you need to turn on to get to the hotel is small and hard to see when coming in late at night as we did. The hotel was very clean, quiet and nicely furnished even at twice the price. We thought the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We did not use the pool but is was nice sized and not overly crowded. Breakfast was adequate, but nothing special. As with most places, don't wait until the last hour of service otherwise expect a smaller selection. It did include some hot items (waffles, eggs, sausage). The high speed wireless internet worked well also.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Go there, but I woudlnt expect having any meal there.”
Reviews.Author: badigard
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Been there in October 2008, and enjoyed the place very much. Rooms were nice, clean, with little refrigerator. Service was OK also. There is a stand where you'll find a Disney representative who can guide you through all the parks around. I ordered from that guy everything. nice and easy. I also recommend checking the price at the nearby wall-mart. Could be cheaper in 2-3$. The only downside in this hotel was the breakfast. as a person who likes health food, I couldn't touch almost nothing there. My suggestion: Go to the main rd, cross it, and you'll see a big supermarket. buy there everything. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beware if the continental breakfast is important to you.”
Reviews.Author: retirednana49
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion in June. We booked 4 rooms, out of which 3 had maintenance problems. 2 of which were repeated problems through out our weeks stay. Breakfast is suppose to be from 6-9am. However, if you wanted the "Hot items", come back in an hour because it wasn't ready. Then, if you came back around 8-8:30 they were out of everything, and you were told 20 minutes! Once, my adult daughter got a very small scoop of eggs and 4 small pieces of sliced sausage, she asked for more, and was told "NO". Thats the only word the servers know how to say, "NO"! They put out maybe 4 or 5 pieces of fruit, and if the fruit is gone and you ask for more, they say, "NO"! So, breakfast isn't really until 9 am, its until they run out of their small supply of food. We informed the front desk, but they didn't seem concerned. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: puckhead124
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. They offer a comp. breakfast with a few hot items. Great if you are looking to save alittle money. Check in fast but before you can get your parking pass you will have to listen to a sales speach about saving money on attactions. This was a little anoying but only lasted about a minute or two. The room was every clean. Had a little trouble with the WIFI but still was able to get on. If you need to use the internet they have a computer in the lobby but there is a charge for it. I did see that they had a shuttle to disney I believe but I didn't use it. If your looking for a nice clean place to stay this hotel is about the nicest place I have seen on 192.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Hotel For The Money!”
Reviews.Author: bobf4080
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least 4 different stays on business. A big thing to me is that the Wi-Fi is free and seems to work excellent everywhere. The rates are excellent and it is a hidden jewel. The rooms are decorated nicely and have a comfortable feel. The hotel has always been extremely clean. Everyday we left and came back to a new fresh room with everything organized. The complimentary breakfast is good for a free breakfast and included eggs, sausage and waffles. The pool is nice and clean and so is the lobby. My opinion that for the money this is an excellent place to stay and very clean and smells good! Would defiantly recommend it. No surprises. The only negative comment I will make is that breakfast ends at 9AM and as someone else said, just avoid the desk with sales pitch off to the side. If you have been in Orlando before you should recognize these anyway and stay away. But the hotel was excellent for the money

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value, great location - BEWARE of the Sales Pitch!”
Reviews.Author: Keston925
Reviews.Content: Checked in, was tired from being caught in a rain storm at Disneys Wild Kingdom, just wanted to check in... check in went smoothly.... but then as the front desk gal hands me my room keys she tells me I have to get my "parking permit" from the "courteousy desk"??? so I turned around and saw four other couples standing in line for their "parking permit" - all of us were wet and tired as we waited and waited... only to realize the hotel clerk just sent us involuntarily and mandatory-to stay there - to get your parking permit - to a sales pitching "I can save you money on attractions" that we were subjected to. And I felt taken advantage of..... the guy had a very hard time taking NO for an answer.... and the next morning while eating breakfast I was approached again! That being said... aside from that which really was a serious TURN OFF and may make you feel that the hotel mandatory sales seminar.... makes the hotel feel a little sleazy... BUT THE REST OF THE HOTEL STAY WAS VERY NICE. The rooms are very updated and nice, clean and exactly what you see in the pictures. The value was good and the location was AWSOME. Allthough I am not positive I would subject myself to being FORCED into a sales seminar again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money.....BUT”
Reviews.Author: Kleersteel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the money, rooms was clean, the view was OK, nothing get excited over. And we would stay there again....BUT, the room service sucked. We were there for 4 days....and only had the room cleaned once. The maid would come and clean the room next door and the room in front of ours....but our room seem to have a curse on it.. We would come back and the room would still be undone. Asked the maid if she can clean, all I got was , "No speak English". So, I would have to grab towels from the cart as she cleaned other rooms. Also, we had booked a queen size bed with a chairs and a table but, was given double queen size beds. I was going to storm down stairs and get it right but my girlfriend said 'don't bother'. Like I said, it's a good hotel compared to the others in the area, but that part brought down a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nandnwilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Orlando to visit theme parks. Rooms recently renovated and very modern. Very clean and comfortable. Microwave/Fridge. Granite counters. "Continental" breakfast well done. Had pastries, juices, coffee, toast, bagels, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage, and pancakes. Very filling and saved us a lot of money not having to purchase breakfast during our stay. High speed wireless internet worked well without problems. Hotel approximately 1 mile from the freeway that leads to all the Disney parks. Hotel offers shuttle to parks, however pickup and return times are extremely limited and I heard they pick up at other hotels as well. Therefore, we strongly recommend a rental car if you want more freedom to move around the parks. We waited until last minute with priceline and got a great price. Pool is small but very clean. Professional pool guy seen cleaning the pool during our stay. Weather was in 90s so we did take advantage of the pool a few times. Walgreens approx 2 blocks away; Perkins right around corner - Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Lonestar, TGI Fridays, Carrabas all within less than 5min drive down 192. As well as a new Super Target. Overall, very good value for the price you pay. Staff friendly and helpful. If you dont need a "resort" atmosphere and plan on spending most of your time at the parks, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Close to everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: JollyTrolley
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. The room had all the amenities you would need....Microwave, Refridgerator, Iron, and board and a nice flat screen TV. It's a great place to stay for the price. The room was contemporary and updated. The bathroom is spacious with double vanities and clean. We spent most of our time at the Disney parks and only wanted a clean and nice place to sleep, shower, and do it again. If you're looking for an immaculate hotel then you should check into the Wynn, Hilton, or an upscale Marriott. There are some flaws as far as appearance but for family fun, and if you're not going to be in your room all day long..this place is great. Oh..it's near all resturants on 192. They offer a complimentary breakfast but its nothing to brag about so you'll probably go out to eat for breakfast. Hope this helps...I'll be staying again if we go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Batman49
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend from March 18th for 3-nights. The rooms are very spacious and very modern, with a flat screen tv, separate seating area. The bathroom is a great size too.. Personally the room reminded me of something you would find at a Marriott. It was a steal at $69 per room per night. Breakfast is also included although a good tip is to get there no later than 830am or you will have slim pickings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for our Trip”
Reviews.Author: ladyj07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a quick getaway to Florida, the hotel was clean and the room was spotless and cleaned very nicely every day. We had a King room which was very room, with a fridge, microwave, also a small couch & table area. They had breakfast which was included (eggs, sausage, pancakes, etc.), but we ate out most days. The hotel is located on a restaurant strip and there were lots of coupons and such for the area food places right at the hotel which is nice for saving money. Although we did laugh a few times when we drove in at night it felt like we were staying on the vegas strip because of all the lights :-) We didn't use the pool, but noticed it was rather small, so if a pool is a major for you, this may not be a good place, I can image how crowded the small pool would be in the Summer. We would definitly stayt here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value--would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel51
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel. Beds were great. Rooms were clean and very modern. We stopped in at 10 am the day we checked in to leave our car and use transportation to Disney. We were disappointed to find out they only ran one shuttle to Epcot around noon and one coming back after the park closed. We ended up just driving. We were pleasantly surprised when they offered to let us go ahead and check in since they had rooms available which saved us a trip back later in the day. Breakfast wasn't great. They had holders for hot food, but nothing in them. All in all we were happy with the room, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Winner”
Reviews.Author: Miceli64
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on resort properties, rented houses and from now on will only stay at the Galleria Palms (Meridian) . Visited January 08, April 08, January 09. Location, location, low price high quality service, furnishigs, cleanliness, facilities, comp breakfast. PC service. Truly above average and consistent visit after visit. Will return mid year 09. 1 mile from World Drive. I called direct and received the best price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms – Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: themntraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights not expecting very much since the rate was so affordable. We were pleasantly surprised! The rooms have recently been remodeled - ours had a fridge, microwave and a flatscreen (but not an HD signal). The bed was comfortable, although not quite as comfy as Marriott. (gotta love the huge bolster pillows) We did not get a chance to try the breakfast or pool. Staff was friendly. Overall a clean place and a good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a convenient location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews are quite accurate about this hotel. It has a VERY convenient location for visiting Disney, and the property is significantly nicer than a "typical" motel. The rooms are, indeed, almost Marriott quality. The public areas aren't quite that spiffy but pretty nice. I even found the free breakfast better than I was expecting. We got eggs, sausage, pancakes and more. Not the tastiest I ever had, but the price was right! For under $60, it would be hard to do better. OK, so what's less-than-perfect about the hotel? The pool is unheated. That's a problem in winter, as Orlando's temperatures are cold enough that, most days, their unheated swimming pool is unusable. Bad if you're travelling with kids during those months. Also, the neighborhood -- while incredibly convenient to Disney and loaded with inexpensive places to eat -- is a bit depressing. This is not the worst stretch of Route 193 (go east of I-4 to see that), but it's not great either. Think tourist trap on steroids. If you want calm, tasteful and refined, this ain't your kind of neighborhood. If you like tacky low brow boardwalk fare, you're in the right place. If you know these 2 negatives in advance, I don't see how you could be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TAJTLA
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel in January 2009. We were impressed that the pictures on the website were exactly what the room looked like. The room was very clean and roomy. Bed was super comfortable with tons of pillows. Breakfast was fine, pancakes,toast,cereal,pastries,coffee & juice. Staff was super nice and helpful. Pool is very small and not heated. We did not need to swim but had we had our kids with us, that is what they want. It was 44 degrees during our stay so swimming would have been a no. Would stay at this hotel again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “they didn't honor Expedia reservation”
Reviews.Author: Andy_from_Bethesda
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia, for a 5-night stay, from Dec-29 to Jan-03 of 2009. Well, right now it is Dec-30-2008 and I am writing this review NOT from this hotel. The reason is that when we arrived there yesterday, with our CONFIRMED Expedia reservation (I have a couple of email from Expedia, the last one from Dec-28th, confirming that the reservation was ok), the hotel did not honor the reservation. When we arrived, we went to the frontdesk, expecting a warm welcome, and all we got was a "I'm sorry but we are sold out". Seriously, that was all, no explanation, no help to try to find an alternative solution, no nothing, they just told us they were sorry, sold out and that we should call 1-800-expedia. We did call Expedia, customer support was great, friendly, trying to be helpful, they even wanted to talk to the hotel frontdesk, but the people at the hotel frontdesk refused to talk to Expedia... "It not our problem". I never thought that would be possible, such unpoliteness, indifference. That was it, that is what I can say about this hotel. You may be lucky and have a good experience there, or you may just be ignored. Toss your coin...

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: jtlongden82
Reviews.Content: What a hotel the Galleria Palms was from check-in to check-out. Me and wife had first booked this hotel at 12:30 in the morning the day we were supposed to go to Disney for 4 days and 3 nights, so it was last minute! I read reviews before that said some had problems with credit cards being charged so we just paid cash which was no problem at all with the hotel. When we first booked the room all they had available was a family suite but we could choose a preference on a King bed which is what we wanted. Well that is what we got! So suprised also when we arrived to the room because what they show you on the pictures is what you get and the pictures we saw are beautiful! The pool was cool looking at night with the blue lights in the water, didnt go in since it was December. The PROS of the hotel would be: microwave in the room along with fridge and coffeemaker, excellent room service, the bathroom was beautiful with the (I think it was granite countertops), the dual sink and it had an elevator. It was also about 1 mile from the Disney exit which it made it that much quicker to get there. The CONS of the hotel I would have to say the is skip the morning breakfast, just didnt look too appetizing to us and even though there was an elevator it could have been a little quicker and the sign could have been bigger for the hotel, but thats it! I give all credit to this hotel and we will be staying here again! For those that do not want to stay on Disney property this hotel is excellent for the money and you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: MickeyFan65
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Nov 23rd to Nov 29th 2008. The room looked just like the pictures on there website. It was clean and had no odor. We opt not to get the house cleaning but one day. We just set our trash out and asked for more towels. My family and I have stayed at this hotel before when it was a Hampton Inn. And that's what it is. A remodeled Hampton Inn. They do offer breakfast in the morning until 9am. It wasn't the best, cereal, toast, mixed fruit and little powered donuts. We got creative and made PBJ with what they had. They have a variety of drink from juice to hot chocolate, tea, coffee, milk. But it got us going in the morning and was free. They have a small pool but was too cold for us to swim. The front desk staff seemed friendly and said Hi as we would walk by. There is a theme park ticket discount booth however you have to go see a timeshare. We got our Disney tickets for $369 for 3 adults and 1 child for 2 days. The timeshare tour was a not that bad. They do bring 2-3 people over to talk you into it and it all sounds like a smart thing to do, but too me it was too much money, so when I was tired of the pressure I just simply said I didn't like the resort...they didn't like that and gave us our tickets and off we go. I would probably not do it again unless I was short on cash. They push you a lot. but we save a lot of $$ doing it. The hotel does offer a shuttle to the theme parks, but we did not use it as it only had ONE pick up time and also picked up other hotels. We drove and parked ourselves. Well worth the extra money. So bottom line, clean rooms, free small breakfast, friendly staff, very close to all Theme Parks. Plenty of fast-food around, Walgreen's down the street. The bad things are the shuttle and weak breakfast. Not a place to stay all day but great for a place to shower and sleep. Oh the bed was comfortable. The pillows are fluffy and thick. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mjomcauli
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. I was little nervous about the place at first since the hall dacor was a bit 80's. However, I was pleasantly surprised when we got to our room. Contemporary furnishings, clean, and large. Bed was very comfortable with lots of plump pillows. The pull out couch however, was very uncomfortable with a slim mattress so that the bar could be felt in your back all night. As a couch it was pretty uncomfortable as well. Otherwise a great room good value and convenient location. Continental breakfast was a bit lame with mini pastries, fruit loops,cornflakes and coffee. Not for diabetics.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Palamino2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 1 week stay at this hotel. It was clean, very comfortable, the rooms were quite modern with a big flat screen tv on the wall. The Air con was quite. The bathroom was clean and had 2 sinks and they left really nice toiletries every day. I thought it was very convenient for the Parks (just off 192) and there were a few eating places within walking distance (Ponderosa, Sizzler, New York Pizza, Colarado Steak House and Black Angus Steak House.) There were a some shops too (grocery store and some gift shops). Plenty of car parking spaces and while at the pool the last morning could keep an eye on the car with all the luggage inside. The pool wasn't very big but was adequate as most people don't use it - we had it to ourselves most of the time. It was serviced by an outside pool maintenance man every day too. The breakfast was free - there was coffee, cold drinks, cereals, waffles, toast, bagels, scone things with gravy!!!!!! and cakes and tinned fruit. It cost approx $50 per night + tax. I would definitely stay there again if I go back to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Galleria Palms for 5 nights. I must say for $50 a night the hotel beyond great. The rooms are better than a 4 star resort. Very clean and very comfortable. We had the King room which had a sitting area with a sofa, two chairs and a large coffee table. There was plenty of closet and storage space, mini fridge and microwave. Housekeeping did a splendid job, as well. Keep in mind, this is not a resort, it does have a small pool however if you are accustomed to resort pools and proporty you will most likely not like it. However, in Orlando I find that I don’t spend too much time in the resorts as most of the days are spent in the parks. For Orlando my main concern is the room to be in great shape.

Reviews.Title: “Unauthorized Billings”
Reviews.Author: MikeDominick
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation online with the Galleria Palms on 9/28/08 for two rooms for one night, 10/5/08, and later cancelled the reservation online on 10/3/08. According to their website, "A 24 hour notice is required for cancellation of any reservation. Otherwise a one day room charge will apply." I received an e-mail confirmation minutes after I sent the cancellation. Upon returning from FL, I realized the Galleria Palms had charged my credit card for both rooms for the night. I immediately sent an e-mail on 10/15/08 (with the e-mail confirmation attached that cancelled the reservation) asking them to credit my account. After two days and no response, I called the front desk on 10/17/08 and was patched to the voice mailbox of James to whom I left a detailed description of the situation, asked him to credit the account and call me back confirming the transaction. Here it is 10/20/08 and no response. Now I noticed that their online reservation system is "powered by: Secure-Res" and am wondering if maybe this has something to do with a third-party that handles their reservations. Regardless, Galleria Palm's lack of response to my inquiries is no way to deal with a situation in which a potential customer was inappropriately charged and, in my opinion, raises the suspicion of fraudulent behavior.

Reviews.Title: “watch your credit card”
Reviews.Author: norcath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 14 nights in september 2008 i booked with a third party and paid with them after 7nights i found that they had taken money from my account to pay for the room, okay they put the money back into my account five days later but they did not pay the right amount back into my account, after speaking to the manager myself and also the company i booked with the matter is still unresolved so please be aware

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, affordable place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reesiecup30
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Galleria Palms hotel in the King suite. My husband and myself were extremely impressed with this hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. This hotel is extremely clean including elevators, hallways and the rooms. I was in absolute amazement over the price and how low it was compared to the way the rooms were, I would have expected to pay well over $100/night for how nicely decorated the rooms were. The king suite includes a pull out sofa in the sitting area as well as a mini refrigerator and microwave. This hotel is so convenient to Disney, we could literally see part of Disney's Blizzard Beach from our window. The next time we are in Orlando we will definitely stay here again and definitely recommend anyone else to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What You See Is What You Get”
Reviews.Author: Zoie01
Reviews.Content: My husband only had the opportunity to stay two nights at the Galleria Palms but believe me when we're in Florida we will be returning.It was wonderful,DO NOT listen to the bad reviews. The hotel is now totally renovated and beautiful,from the moment you walk into the lobby you feel welcomed.Everyone is so kind and helpful.Elisabeth was at the front desk and is a sweetie. The rooms are fantastic,we had a King Suite which had a King bed,(the mattress was perfact) a sitting area (the couch pulled out to another bed)there was a table and two chairs,Mini fridge/freezer,micro-wave,Vizo flat screen t.v.and a wardrobe for clothing not to mention lots of drawers.The bathroom had double sinks,a wonderful shower with a rain head faucet (great after a long day at Disney)granite counter tops through out.A wet bar with a little sink and a coffee maker was between the bath a sitting/bedroom area. Rooms are spotless as were the hallways.Everywhere we went in the hotel was clean.The restrooms in the hallway by the pool area wasn't overlooked either.The pool was great. They have the most wonderful breakfast buffet also.We were offered Pancakes,scrambled eggs,sausage,biscuits/gravy, bagles(condiments to top your bagles)cold cereals,hot cereals,fresh fruits cut up,mini donuts,mini muffins,crumb cakes, orange juice,apple juice,lemonade,coffee,tea ,milk something for everyone,the area where the food was served was perfactly arranged and very clean,a lady kept coming out and refilling everything and cleaning up any spills etc.. it was a great way to start your day. Add to all the above your within walking distance to many many resturants Black Angus,I HOP,Crabby Bill's Seafood,Kool's Oak Fire Grill to name a few,lot's of small shops to look around in.And if that's not enough the hotel offers free shuttle to Disney, and Epcot.We decided we didn't want to drive or fight for parking so we saved the parking fee and rode the shuttle,yes they do stop at a few other hotels but we were there in a short time,and we returned on it right up to the hotel. So don't always go by the negative reviews,the photo's and the features are exactally what you will find at the Galleria Palms and then some.And if you would like to see a room before checking in they will show you!!Go see for yourselves I'm sure you'll return also!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room-Nice and clean!!”
Reviews.Author: sendsilk
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews my wife and I were hesitant to stay at the Galleria Palms. The picture shows a Hampton Inn and it WAS a Hampton Inn that was bought by a company named Meridian. The hotel staff was courteous and the rooms just like pictured online and clean! Close proximity to Disney (about 3 minutes) and to Sea World (about 10 minutes). My kids loved breakfast and the room was rather spacious with fridge, flat screen TV, coffemaker, double bathroom sinks, granite countertops and a sitting area. You really can't ask for more with a price of $69.99 per night. I would let someone going here know just a couple of minor details-The road going to the entrance to the hotel could use some spiffing up but no big deal. It would appear they have converted to a Condo timeshare judging by the corporate name-Meridian Condo Owners Assoc. and there was a very friendly man and upon arrival he wanted to give us our " Welcome packet". I have stayed at Caribe Cove-VERY NICE- and Vistana, and several other timeshare units and it is no big hassle, just tell them no thank you, as we did, and we were left alone. Finally the pool area is extremely simple, just one long square pool with some lounging chairs and tables..no bar or restaurant, but when you are at the parks all day it really did not matter to us. There are many restaurants within a short walking distance and anything you could possibly want within a 10 minute drive. Finally, one thing about the negative reviews...most of them appear to be when the hotel ran out of water for about 1 day at least 6 months ago. I believe this is somewhat unfair as it has skewed the review scale of this hotel. Obviously angry customers are more apt to write a bad review of the place than happy or content customers. It is not a Four Seasons, but than again it is only about 1/4 of the price of a 5-star hotel. My family and I would not hesitate to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Really impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: katyglover
Reviews.Content: We were vacationing in the Orlando area during the Hurricane Fay and had originally planned to go to Palm Coast. We changed plans due to the storm and decided to extend our stay in Orlando for 3 days. I saw reviews on Galleria Palms, and decided to give the hotel a shot. We drove up to the location, who had recently changed from Meridian Palms, to a sign that had a name change covering the "Meridian" with "Galleria." My husband looked at me, and rolled his eyes, telling me we'd found a real dive, and that so far he was not impressed. I was worried that my record of booking good hotels was ruined! I went into the hotel and checked in, and we warmly greeted by the front desk. She confirmed my information, and I was given our keys. We went to the room. and it was just as pictured. The whole hotel was extremely well lit, bright, and recently renovated. The double sinks in the bathroom were an extra bonus, and the Bath and Body Works toiletries were a nice touch. Breakfast in the morning was not your 'typical continental breakfast.' It featured Seattle's Best Coffees, Teas, assorted juices, milk, cereals, eggs, meats, fresh pastries, fresh fruits, breads, etc. The pastries were not typical hotel donuts, but fresh cakes and struesels. It was truly a well-maintained breakfast area that would satisfy picky eaters, and one that satisfied a 'foodie' such as myself. The housekeeping staff was truly the best, however. Our room was impeccably cleaned every day, better than I have ever seen by a housekeeping staff. They were observed pulling out fixtures and vacuuming under and around them, even when just refreshing rooms for guests staying there for longer terms. After we checked out, I noticed I'd forgotten my lap-top in the room. I was mortified, and contacted them that evening. I was told that housekeeping had gone home for the evening, but they took my name and phone number advising they'd find out the status of it in the morning, and also said I could call back in the morning. I called back in the morning first thing, and I was advised my lap-top was in the general manager's office. Since we were in Clearwater, we chose to drive there and pick it up. Crisis averted! I was delighted with their care of my valuable possessions and their great attitude. All in all, my experience with the hotel was fantastic. I'd highly recommend them for a great stay and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised and Amazed!”
Reviews.Author: swtgapch
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. When I read the reviews at TripAdvisor I was a little skeptical about making reservations. All the reviews we had read were all good. One reviewer said, the hotel was just like the pictures on the website and believe its true. We had a king room with a pull out sofa and the bed was very comfortable. The room had a microwave, fridge, flat screen (Vizio) television. I really loved the marble and tile in the bathroom. The hotel has a very nice contemporary style. Cleaniness is a very big issue with me when I go to hotels and it was very clean. All of our needs were meet here and the front desk was very courtesy to our request. I would definitely stay here again. Oh yea, the hotel also has a breakfast. The pool is very well maintained. It's very quiet here as well. My family and I loved. Do not let some of the othe review scare you away. Whatever pictures you see on the website, that's what the hotel actually looks like. You'll really like it here. I really thought the hotel price would be a little higher but it was not. Very reasonable price. I am going to recommend this hotel to my family and friends whenever they visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money....”
Reviews.Author: bestseller013
Reviews.Content: Previewed this hotel on the web, really liked the photos of the hotel... and some reviewers stated this hotel looked exactly like the pictures on its website. Well, took a gamble and it's true! If you go by the website pictures that is what you get....bed very comfortable, great bathroom, wonderful water pressure and holds warm temp just fine (very important!). Very, very clean place!! Breakfast is not complimentary but they offer a discount if you pay for it upon check in. Didn't try it but looked just average for this type of hotel.....no lavish buffet. Pool fine...alot of kids of course...this hotel would be fine for a night or long weekend. You can walk to alot of shops and places to eat. Quiet at night and staff nice. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: hhbusymom
Reviews.Content: Wow-- I was very suprised at this hotel. We have Disney passes and stayed at alot of hotels in Kissimmee and this one is the best. The price is right, the rooms are big and clean. The decor is beautiful. I love the extra touch of the bath and body works. They have a pretty good breakfast. The pool was nice also. Very nice and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoteyes44
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Galleria Palms, and I must say the hotel is very beautiful and very clean. It looks as if it has been recently built. The continental breakfast was very good, and the front desk staff was very friendly. The excessive taxes charged on the room, and the outrageous fees for telephone usage was upsetting. All in all great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: LuvinTn
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to this particular hotel for ten years now. It's been through several different owners and several different names, but we've always loved it. The last time we were there in February we were a little disappointed with breakfast. That was one of the perks of the hotel and one reason we kept coming back. As a Florida resident we can usually get a Disney value resort for the same price as your hotel, and with it being right on Disney property and being able to get free parking in Disney parks, usually the only thing that kept us coming to this hotel was breakfast. This last weekend the breakfast was just as bad as in February. I used to eat fruit, real fruit not from a can, nor rotten. Now it's peaches in a can or rotten oranges and bananas. There would be yoplait yogurt which was great and skim milk to drink. My daughter always had waffles, sausage patties and eggs. My hubby would have a bit of everything and my other daughter would have raisin bran cereal, a bagel, again not hard, and a donut, not old and stale. The other thing was that they now have timeshare property gurus in the lounge, we do not like that at all. It interrupted breakfast. When we checked in I was told to go over there to that desk and get a coloring book for my daughters, not only was there no coloring book and we had been lied to but then I was hounded about getting free nights for some timeshare junk. This makes the hotel unbecoming, if you want to sell timeshares that's their prerogative, but put the desk somewhere other then the lounge and don't lie to people to get them there. Next, I didn't have automatic checkout as usual, I disliked that. I got to the desk where a young lady was talking to family or friends on the phone. After waiting for 5 minutes an older lady came over, Asked me for my last name, I told her and said the first letter was B like boy. She said v like victor? I said no, b like boy, or banana. I waited two or so minutes, then she said v like victor? I said no ma'am, B like a-b-c- ; b like boy; b like banana; b, then spelled my name again. Then the girl got off the phone, came over pointed to the screen and finally I got a paper to sign, which I already signed when I checked in and the I got my copy and they said nothing to me, no questions about my stay, no thank you for staying with us, nothing. To me, this was just appalling. At this point I am not sure I am going to stay there anymore. I've always referred people to the hotel, in all I know at least a dozen have stayed there, but I will not be referring anyone anymore nor do I think I will be staying there. The rooms are clean, immaculately clean. They give you bath and body works toiletries. There is a micro and fridge in every room. So if you eat somewhere else and can deal with the ladies at check in and check out, then I think for the money, atleast it's clean.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs!!”
Reviews.Author: MGoBlue11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at this hotel. We arrived in Orlando early and they allowed us to check in early. The staff at the front desk was friendly. The room was exactly as pictured on their website. It was very clean and the best thing about it was that the beds were very comfortable. The pillows were a little tall but that was OK. The bathroom was clean and that is important because I hate dirty bathrooms. The shower was clean and there was plenty of hot water with lots of pressure. The shampoo from Bath and Body Works was great. The hotel also offered free continental breakfast each morning. For the most part this was very good. Each morning featured a hot offering as well as a wide variety of pastries and frozen waffles to be toasted. The fruit offering left a little to be desired. Isn't Florida supposed to have good fruit? But it was a great money saver and a kick start before we hit the parks. Maybe the best thing about the hotel is that it was literally 5 minutes from the parks. The pool was tiny but our children enjoyed it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRVV
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean property! Loved the flat panel TV. Very comfortable beds. Room was equipped with microwave, refrigerator, and separate "kitchen" sink which wasn't even mentioned in the hotel accomodations. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Accomodations were well above expectations. Don't pass this one up.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesfan04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night in May 2008. It is close to everything. Attractions, Resturants, shops all within mintues of your front door. The staff is personable and great providers of directions. The rooms are modern and in great condition. Will definately be staying here more often on our trips to Disney,

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: tns183
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here 4/10-4/15. It was really nice. I was a little worried since I rarely have used a website to book a hotel but the room was clean and comfortable. The only thing that I found uncomfortable was that it felt humid at night. There were lots of pillows and the bed was really nice! The room looked like the pictures. It was also nice to get Bath & Body Works soap, shampoo and conditioner, smells a lot better than some hotel soap! We went to Disney World everyday, and the shuttles were nice but you either have to catch one at 8:15am or 11:50am (they sometimes ran late). The latest back to the hotel was 10:25pm. We would have opted for a later return on some nights. In all I would definitely go back to this hotel. I'm usually really picky about places being clean and this place was very clean! The front desk people we had contact with were always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked It”
Reviews.Author: vivian3553
Reviews.Content: My family and I have Disney Annual Passes, therefore, needless to say, we go to Disney often. Probably once a month. I've stayed at just about every Disney Resort and many others around the area. Once in a while I look for new places to stay just to change things up a bit. I found the Galleria Palms by researching different sites, including TripAdvisors. First let me start by saying i was really impressed with the renovated rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the flat screen tv was a plus. The bathroom was updated as it had dual sinks and granite countertops. The lobby is normal as are the hallways. The free breakfast and Seattle's Best Coffee was a great addition because that saved us about $25/day. I thought the staff was friendly and had no problems with them. I also liked the Bath & Body Works amenities. And it was only about a minute and a half from the entrance to Disney grounds. I really think this is a good kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “a good place overall”
Reviews.Author: terri-n
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children and I stayed at Galleria Palms in Kissimmee March 11-18 2008. It was a good place to stay. The location is off the main drag, so it's quiet. The rooms are clean and well-appointed [I'm especially picky about carpets, and these were very clean] and the towels are restocked and the beds are remade every day. The breakfast buffet is stocked with milk, juices, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, various fruits [not very good selection], cold cereals and oatmeal packets, various pastries and muffins, breads, bagels and English muffins, and sometimes biscuits, hard-cooked eggs and sausage gravy. Perfectly adequate, and quite a money-saver. It opens daily at 6am. The only pool is outside the lobby, is quite small, and is not heated. Quite a shock after a hot day in the theme parks! The Lynx bus stop is almost directly in front of the hotel, and the #55 bus can get you to the WalMart Super Centre when travelling west, or you can cross the highway to the bus stop on the other side and catch the #55 going east. Ask for a transfer to the #56 bus which will take you to the Disney Transportation Centre where you can catch a Disney bus to any park. The cost of the Lynx is $1.25 per adult, and 85 cents for school-age children. It runs roughly every 30 minutes all day until about 9pm, and is much better than the shuttles provided by the Galleria, which have very poor time schedules. The restaurants in the neighbourhood of the Galleria are great. The Bob Evans is about 10 minutes walk east, on the same side of the highway. Excellent childrens menu. The IHOP directly in front of the hotel is also good. And if you cross the highway, there's a Ponderosa almost directly across, and a Golden Corral about 10 minutes walk west...excellent buffet selections. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and will try the Galleria again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Galleria Palms”
Reviews.Author: MLSMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ATTEMPTED to stay at the Galleria Palms hotel for three nights in November 2007. We prepaid our reservation through Travelocity and received a great discounted rate. We were excited to stay at this hotel as it looked very nice on the website and it was a great location. We arrived on Saturday night around 8:30pm, tired from traveling all day. The hotel looked pretty full and the lobby was busy. We gave the manager at the front desk our name. He clicked around on the 'puter for a minute or so and then said that he did not have a reservation under that name. I thankfully had a copy of the confirmation from Travelocity so I pulled that out to show him that we were confirmed for a three day stay. At that point, he claimed that he never received the reservation from Travelocity, and that they have had this issue with Travelocity before. I asked if he had any rooms available that we could reserve and he said he had no vacancy, but that he could offer me a room at the hotel's "sister" property a couple miles away for the same rate, but we'd have to pay for it upfront and then negotiate with Travelocity to get our money back on our "confimed" reservation, since it was Travelocity's fault for not faxing them the reservation. Because we were very tired and just wanted a place to stay for one night before trying to figure out what to do for the next two nights, we went to check out the sister property which of course was not nearly as nice as the Galleria Palms. We checked out the room and then told the desk clerk that we might be back (if we couldn't find anything else.) The clerk pressured us to book a reservation right then, as the room may not be available later. (Funny because the hotel parking lot was nearly empty.) To make a very long story short, we knew something didn't seem right about the whole situation. We think that because we had prepaid through Travelocity at such a low rate (about $60 per night,) they had an opportunity to sell our room for more money and double booked our room, "lost" our less profitable reservation, and then conveniently blamed Travelocity for the mishap. And on top of all that, they wanted us to spend the same amount of money to reserve a room at their less than desirable "sister" property. No thanks! We ended up staying a few miles away at the Comfort Suites (clean and nice, by the way.) We called Travelocity and they agreed to refund our money and our refund was in our account by the time we returned from Orlando. Bottom line: Beware of the Galleria Palms. It may be a great room for the price, IF you are able to actually stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MouseLocker
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Galleria Pams for three nights after staying at Disney's Beach Club. Overall impression was very good. The room appears to have been updated. Nice flat screen TV. Room was clean and comfortable. Located on HWY 192 near Disney World (Animal Kingdom) and Hwy 4 so easy access to any major park. They have a shuttle service but we didn't need it as we had our own car. Continental breakfast was so so. Coffee was good, fresh and hot. They had a nice selection of oranges, apples and banana's however once they were gone they were not replaced so you would need to get up early for the fresh fruit. Free High Speed Internet access added to the value. We will return to the Galleria Palms again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, will come back.”
Reviews.Author: CCSJ
Reviews.Content: We were there from 3/6 to 3/9 for baseball spring training games. We experienced no problems. Our room looked just like the ones on the pictures on this website and the hotel's website. Clean rooms, good solid breakfast, easy check-in and easy check out and a relaxing environment. We did, however experince, one morning, the noisy sanitation truck unloading the trash bin in the parking lot right next to the hotel at 6:00 am. It certainly woke us up. While we personally did not experiece any problems with the water situation. We did see and hear several people complaining about their lack of water on Saturday, 3/8 (I think). People became loud when the front lobby employee was unable to provide any kind of service or compensation. Not having water to bathe for one day can happen at any hotel. But a hotel needs to have a plan B in place when this happens. We saw them working on water pipes, all day long, the day before, in the back of the hotel, outside. They knew there would be problems but they did not make preperations for it. Bottom line for me, I really liked the location. Easy to get to the games at Disney's WWWofSports. Easy to get to Downtown Disney and all the parks for that matter. Pay under $100 a night, for such easy access, close to a lot of good places to eat, clean modern rooms, with a bathroom that matches any $200+ a night hotels. Very good security when coming in from other entrances other than the front lobby. Beside the "lack-of-water-for-one-day" issue, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Started out great, ended badly!!”
Reviews.Author: J_Alaska40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galleria Palms for 3 nights during our vacation. It started out just fine-rooms are nice and clean, pool is very small and not heated but my kids didn't care and used it anyway. Continental breakfast is fine-the usual fruits, waffles, bagels and coffee-with a nice seating area. It all went downhill, however, when the water lines broke and we were without water from 2pm until 8am the following day. As another traveler stated, management disappeared and left no instructions for the staff. We were repeatedly told, over the course of the evening, that the water would be back on in "30 minutes". The staff then tried to say several hotels were out of water that day, even though they had said earlier that a pipe had broken in their hotel . They did not offer anything to the guests-no bottled water, no restroom availability, nothing. They barely apologized for the incident, as they continued to insist it was no one's fault and *these things happen*. Sure, these things happen, but in the hospitality industry, one must go the extra mile to make sure that guests are happy and taken care of! The next morning, I called downstairs and politely said I would like a refund for the night we had no water.The front desk person told me that I was *the only person who had asked for a partial refund* and that there was nothing he could do-I would have to call the general manager on Monday. Funny when I went downstairs there were several other disgruntled guests asking for just the same thing. Someone finally insisted that the front desk call the general manager at home, and she authorized refunds over the phone for any guests who asked. As someone who had worked in the tourism/travel industry for many years, I was appalled at way guests were handled. A general manager who leaves her inexperienced staff to handle a MAJOR issue has no business being in charge. She should have come in that morning to help the staff deal with the situation, especially since the hotel has a policy (which we saw posted at the front desk) in which all refunds must go throug the general manager. Shame on her for leaving her staff hanging! And the put-upon attitude of the staff that people would *dare* ask for refunds for the night they had no water was not appreciated. What exactly did the hotel think would happen? We'd all be thrilled to have no water, no showers, no toilets and not breathe a word of complaint or ask for any compensation? Pathetic. The experience left a bad taste in my mouth and while the hotel itself is nice, I will not stay there again, nor will I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: WDW1971
Reviews.Content: Check in/out was easy and hassle-free. The hotel looked like it had been recently remodeled with ceramic tile and contemporary furniture in the lobby and room. The room itself was clean and comfortable. A free breakfast was available but we did not have time to try it. Complementary shuttles were available to the Disney theme parks. The stay was worth the price. We would try this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Headache...Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlrjgc
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation at this hotel through the AAA website a few weeks in advance of my stay. Our plans ended up changing and I subsequently canceled my reservation. I received a confirmation of the cancellation and even called the hotel to confirm. Upon receiving my last credit card statement I realized that I was still charged for my stay! When I called the hotel to disbute the charges the woman that I spoke with told me that I had checked in and stayed at their hotel and that they had records! I was shocked and when I asked to see these "records" she said she would call me back. When she returned my call she stated that I hadn't checked in but was a no show so they charged my card. I told her that I had a cancellation confirmation but she said that they had no record of it. I find it odd that they received the reservation confirmation but not the cancellation confirmation. I am still disbuting these charges but so far all I have is a charge for a hotel that I never stayed at and interest racking up on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: LorraineOttawa
Reviews.Content: We we re so impressed that we decided to come back again next year. We asked for a quiet room when we called to book and that is exactly what we got. The rooms were really clean, the staff were quite helpful, the continental breakfast was good and the bed was really comfortable. The only complaint is that the pillows were TOO BIG otherwise great place to stay. Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money...”
Reviews.Author: michaeltad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Galleria for one night and it was a truly wonderful hotel. Small and simple yet very clean. I got a deal from Spirit air for this hotel for $59 a night, coming out to about $66 with all taxes. The lady at the desk said the going rate if you walked in off the street was about $119. Finding the hotel is a bit hard, but look for the large mermaid gift shop and Ihop and it is right behind that. GPS took us right there. Check in was about ten minutes with everything being handled very easily. Got switched to a king bed room no problem. The pictures of the room on their website is very close to what you get. Breakfast in the lobby area was not amazing, but just what we needed and free. Bagels, coffee with cream, apples, tea, etc. I will be back in the Orlando area and would stay here again. Michael from Tampa

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: tampabobl
Reviews.Content: Pro: 1. Clean but smallish room. 2. Decent breakfast. 3 Free wireless interent but not in the room. (See below). 4 Non-smoking for the whole place. Con: 1. Upon checking in the clerk seemed confused and immediately started talking to another clerk in Spanish. They should be speaking English. 2. The hotel description leads one to believe that the rooms have wireless internet. They don't. You can only get it in the dining room and lobby. 3. The message light constantly blinked although I had no messages. I had it turned off, it came on again. 4. They charge a "resort fee" of $5.95 a day. This is no resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with stay!”
Reviews.Author: onesensibletraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here and checked out feeling very impressed with the cleanliness and modern feel of the hotel (I only paid $80 a night)! Upon entering the room, aside from the great decoration with the fabrics, I was impressed with the large flat screen television mounted on the wall. I always take my laptop when I travel so the complimentary internet was a big plus! The parking was close and convenient. The shampoo, lotion, and soaps were from Bath & Body - nice touch. The bed was sooo comfortable and the pillows were so soft, I slept soundly. For travelers who tend to suffer from "I'd sleep better if I was in my own bed" syndrome, it was a welcoming change to sleep comfortably on a bed booked at a hotel under $100 a night. The continental breakfast experience wasn't that great. If you get down there late, (like around 9:30-10am) you miss most of - actually, all of it. I was only able to take advantage of the coffee. So as the cliche goes, the early bird gets the worm there. Despite of my empty belly, I would definitely stay here on my next trip and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just as Expected”
Reviews.Author: Bump-In-The-Night
Reviews.Content: After reading countless Trip Advisor reviews of hotels in the Orlando/Kissimmee area we decided upon The Galleria Palms for a 4-night stay from Jan 12 - 16/2008. The hotel and room were as expected, check-in was effortless and the room was clean, quiet and the air conditioning unit was modern and worked very well without excessive noise. The free continental breakfast consisted of choice of two cereals, toast, bagels, mini-muffins, pastries, hard-bolied eggs, freezer-style waffles, fruit salad, milk, tea, coffee, orange/apple juice. The staff made every effort to keep supplies stocked but arriving late meant that some things were unavailable. The wireless internet was free and worked well (if you have your laptop w/you) but the sole computer in the lobby required a fixed fee of $5 + $1/printed page... a little excessive. Mapquest and other "direction" sites have you turning right after the hotel off of US192 onto but you can turn directly onto Maingate Lane from US192 just before the Tourist shop with the 30ft Mermaid just after Marker 6. The "Maingate Lane" street sign is hard to see but you can't miss the Mermaid on your right just after where you should turn. The hotel is about 500 metres ahead on your left... if you drive past the Radisson on your right, you've gone too far. There is a low-pressure time share office in the lobby which will get you discounted tickets if you want to waste a day being pitched a time share deal. The desk staff appeared indifferent but not unfriendly and the housekeeping staff were excellent. I managed to get a $70/night rate by calling directly to the hotel which was quite a bit better than the $89 rate I got from their website. Either way, I would definately stay there again... 5 minute drive to Disneys' Animal Kingdom and only 20 minutes (northeast on I-4) to Universal Studios. Also saved us time driving to Tampa (Busch Gardens) since connecting highway is south of Orlando, closer to Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1512
Reviews.Content: We have just come back after having stayed at The Galleria Palms from the 15-21 January 2008. Contrary to some reviews here the hotel was very very easy to find, even in the dark!! (If you are unsure about finding a place print directions on Google before you travel and you won't get lost anywhere in the world, guaranteed). The hotel is very nicely decorated and the rooms are enormous - and I have never slept so well in a hotel as I did here. The beds are just fantastic and the rooms are so spotlessly clean that you can eat your food off the floor. Had a lovely quiet room on the 4th floor that had a fridge and microwave which was great. The Staff in Reception are very friendly and helpful. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone - it's cheap, spotlessly clean and unbelievably good value. They even provide breakfast (Continental, and not just muffins and coffee) every morning from 06.00 absolutely free. Ps. The bathroom products are just wonderful...!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: DorvalBuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights over New Year's 2008. The hotel is a bit hard to find (it is between Marker 6 & 5 on Highway 192 W., behind the IHOP) The room was extremely clean, with a wall mounted TV, a microwave, a fridge, a small couch and table, and a coffee machine (the only thing missing was tea). Although the breakfast buffet in the lobby is not large, it has a good variety of the basics and was well stocked. The location of the hotel is great for a Disney visit (about a mile from the Disney exit on the 192) We were no farther than about a twenty minute drive to any of the parking lots. There a plenty of restaurants on the 192 if you don't want to eat on the Dinsey site. Other reviews in this site complain about reservation number problems when people check in. This is probably due to the hotel changing names in Sept. 2007. The Merdian (as it was called) had a longer reservation number while the new Galleria has a four digit number. Anyone who has booked under the old name should call to confirm their reservation and get a new number. This could have been avoided if they had notified all people with existing reservations under the old name to notify them of the change. We will defintely go back and would defintely recommend the Galleria for price, location, and hotel features.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: francefam
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the money. I found out that if you book directly with the hotel you can get 10% off of travelocity and expedia. The front desk was always there to help 24 hours. The beds are so plush we slept soundly every night. I could not beleave how clen the rooms are. You can walk around without shoes and not get your socks dirty. Breakfast is good, but a little more fruit would have been good. The coffee is Seattle's Best.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service: Lost Reservation, No Help from Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EliHertz
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel through onetravelsource.com We received a confirmation email showing confirmed room for our two night stay starting with first night on 12/28. We called several hours before our night of arrival into Orlando and were told that they did not have any rooms, and that they showed our reservation for 12/20. Even though we had email confirmation of our scheduled arrival date, neither the hotel nor onetravelsource.com would honor our reservation. The hotel kept us on hold for almost two hours, and made no attempt to book us at another hotel and also told us we would be charged a no show for the night we never booked. Attempts to reach the General Manager to rectify resulted in no return calls. Book this hotel at your own risk. We have two complaints into Better Business Bureau, one for the hotel and one for the web site how kept us on hold and did nothing to help us find a room when we pointed out that the reservation they took and accepted was not honored.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wheezyone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this motel (resort/hotel,misleading) for 7 days. The rooms are extremely small. There is no bathtub and the shower/toilet are confined to a closet sized room. The first day we were supplied with Bath & Body products as they claim in their advertising. That was the only time we saw them, the rest of the stay were generic products. On our 3rd day we had a visitor behind our curtain , a small lizard !!!! NOT IMPRESSED. A towel was placed in the shower before showering, says alot about the cleanliness and sandals worn on carpets and we are certainly not neat freaks. Needless to say, pictures and info are not always accurate. Many more " resorts " to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aquaero
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AWESOME!! The price was super also (via expedia)!! I surely recommend this hotel!! My girlfriend compared a lot of hotels on reviews on many websites, she found this one to be the best, so we decided to book! And we had a great holiday!! The only little thing to mention is the breakfast.. unfortunately they don't have fresh fruit and yoghurt, but hey! The room, the service, cleanliness, the pool, the location (US192: close to tourist info center, Hertz, many restaurants and ofcourse the Disney Parks), everything is GREAT!!! We will return to this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: alexandria
Reviews.Content: We did not have directions to this hotel after leaving enteratainment at Downtown Disney. We had the phone number, no problem, right? WRONG. This hotel did not answer the phone for the entire 2 hours we were lost in Kissimmee! When we finally found it, the desk clerk was in a room behind the front desk office ASLEEP! I had to shout to wake him up. Anyone could have robbed the place. I said we tried calling for two hours he said "the phones haven't been working". What type of business has phones that are not working? I gave my confirmation number only to be told no reservation found and that their confirmation numbers were only 4 digits so I must be mistaken. He then tried to look it up by lastname, again no match or offer to assist in any way whatsoever. He seemed annoyed that we woke him up. We left there and got a room across the street at America's Best Value Inn, desperate for a place to sleep at this point. Who, there, were very polite empathetic about our situation. The next morning I called again, surprise! Meridian Palms phone number was working. I explained my situation about the night before only to be told she would look into it, took my number and said she would call my cell back. Never did. When I returned home from my travels, I called yet again and asked to speak to manager she was unavailable. I then found the gm email address and forwarded her my email reservation that I received prior to my trip directly from Meridian Palms, which I still have if anyone would care to view it. She did return the call only to say they never charged my credit card. She asked that I identify the desk clerk who was asleep on the job, I did. Do they not know who they had working the night of November 16, 2007? Perhaps this is a great place to stay but I simply cannot get over that I was never given an apology for all of the trouble much less any type of consolation or compensation. I will never stay here and will never recommend this hotel to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “For $50 it is hard to complain; but...”
Reviews.Author: Slyclone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Galleria for a week beginning 11/15. We booked a king through Hotels.com for $50 a night. First thing to know is that mapquest directions are wrong.
