There is not an exit 64a/b. Take exit 64(192 east) from I-4. Go until you see Houlihans (purple sign) on the left. Take the road between Houlihans and McDonalds to the hotel parking lot. Second thing to know is to book an even numbered room. These face the trees and not the road. Before we unpacked, we could tell the room was too small for 2 people and asked to be moved to a double. The front desk informed us that this was not possible since we booked through hotels.com. Twice during the week we asked for directions to Kennedy space center (60 miles away) and St Augustine (100 miles away). She offered to mapquest, but after getting burned by mapquest once already, we were hoping for some local knowledge. We told her not to bother. The previously mentioned Houlihans is a great place for happy hour. And the food is pretty good. It is great when you can walk home from a happy hour. The breakfast served at the hotel is as advertised. The housekeeper never knocked. Yet the room was made every day when we came back. The tolietries were from Body Works; nice! So what was wrong besides a small room and difficult front desk? The ice machine on the second floor did not work all week. And the room was not clean. Personally, clean is a state of mind. But my wife noticed that her feet became dirty/grey when she walked across the carpet and tile. Thankfully, she did not take notice of the other things. Looking at the picture of the shower, you can see what looks like wine stains on the wall in the upper right. The pocket door to the toilet and shower had mildew stains on it. Another annoyance was the reception for the TV would sometimes "snow up" or get "lightning bolts" streaking across it. For $50, I could live with the problems. I left $25 in tips, and some chocolates, for our house keeper. We never complained to the front desk and had a nice week.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is a little hard to find, it is back behind the road (look for the Radisson sign). This hotel is an amazing value and is decorated in an updated "boutique" style fashion. Beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping is a little too 'eager' and knock constantly on your door. As mentioned by other reviewers, Bath & Body Works toiletries is a nice touch. Room includes mini-fridge, microwave and additional mini 'bar' sink and coffee maker. Rooms are not too soundproof, can easily hear the water running but very clean, new hotel. LCD TV is nice and furnishings are quite modern. Free breakfast buffet is a little meagre (they don't seem to replenish too often) but I didn't expect much for the price. My only complaint is that although the hotel offers free wireless, it does not provide guests with free internet access for those who do not have their laptops with them. I found the location not as convenient as the other hotels closer to I-drive, but cannot beat the price. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This hotel is very, very nice. I thought I was in a swanky NYC hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jesscruick
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to tell you about our recent stay at this hotel. My husband and I stayed November 8-11, 2007 for his 40th Birthday. He participated in the ESPN Golf school in St. Cloud and we also went to Universal Studios. We thought your hotel was lovely and very comfortable. I could not believe the hotel price per night. What a deal. I felt as if I was staying in a swanky NYC hotel. We loved the decor of the room and the fact that we had a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator was really nice. The hotel is in a great location to I-4 and all the attractions. All the hotel staff was very, very accommodating. I loved the Bath & Body Works toiletries in the bathroom. What a treat! With airline restrictions it was nice to have a quality product available at the hotel. Thanks for a great mini vacation and we will be back and maybe we will bring the kids next time!!! Ha Ha! I will spread the word! JC Charleston, WV PS. The only negative thing, was the breakfast bar. It never seamed to be stocked when we tried to eat a bite.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: gandamarielle_sw
Reviews.Content: We always stay in 3 star hotels because our budget is limited but this hotel doesn't deserve 2 stars, it should be the very least a 3 star hotel. It's the best hotel we've stayed in so far. We loved the beds, the pillows, the carpets are very clean, and of course the big plasma TV on the wall! another bonus is the bath and body soap, shampoos, conditioner and lotion that they provide everyday irregardless of whether you finished the previous day's supply or not. If you want a view to see the fireworks ask for a parkview room. we stayed on the fourth floor and although quite far, you'll still see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom. The breakfast is adequate and they constantly replenish the food. if you've not read the tips from the other reviewers for this hotel regarding how to go there, here it is: as you head on to I192 past marker 6 turn right when you see this gigantic mermaid souvenir store, the hotel is behind it. when you want to go to the parks there's also a short cut using osceola parkway - ask the front desk for the direction. and if you're heading back to the hotel from any of the disney theme parks, look for the sign for "animal kingdom lodge" and you'll go back to osceola parkway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: moni8ch
Reviews.Content: We traveled for my mom's birthday to visit Epcot for the Wine and Food Festival, I was a bit concerned in staying at this hotel since usually I only stay at large hotel chains. My family was pleasantly surprised. Here are the perks: 1. Price per night, we paid $150 for 2 nights on a weekend with Expedia. It's a bargain for the quality and location. ( 2 queen beds) 2. Rooms very nicely remodeled and cleaner than some of the major hotel chains I've stayed in the past. Bathrooms feature Bath and Body toiletries. (Gotta love that if you are girl). Beds looked brand new as well as the linens. Plenty of pillows-if you are like me that likes sleeping in almost flat pillows, I recommend to bring your own, the hotel ones are very puffy. 3. The breakfast in the morning was also a plus .(people gave bad reviews on what was included, but you get what you paid for). Always had plenty of coffee, great tea selection, milk, juices and pastries/breads. Also had hard boiled eggs second day of our stay. 4. transfers to the park is a plus if want to save some money in parking. 5. Great location, plenty of restaurants & shopping areas Close to all Disney parks- about 10 min. 6. Good service, we asked for towels from housekeeping and got them in about 10 minutes from our call. 7. They have a desk at the lobby to buy tickets for parks and also dinner shows etc...very convenient. Constructive criticism: 1. Breakfast could feature more fruit 2. Lobby / breakfast area could use a little fix it up since this might deter potential guests away. The lobby looks a bit tired /old. Very different from the rooms "modern look" that the hotel features on the website/ reviews. Overall a great value!!! Will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Powerpuffy
Reviews.Content: Had some probs with Travelocity (forgot to fax my booking to the hotel) but the girl at the front desk was a great help! Room was small but very clean and had every thing you needed. Nice big shower and a lot of free expensive shampoos etc. The bed was amazing. Kingsize was huge and the mattress was very comfortable. Free parking, small breakfast, internet, 15 min from Disney and SeaWorld and I only paid $41 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pennstater
Reviews.Content: I booked my florida resident rate room online at the hotel's site when the name was Meridian Palms. A few days before check in I called to verify the res. and noticed the name change of the hotel.. They honored the res. no problem. I won't mention the common things already mentioned in most positive reviews since I agree with them. I will add that the towels were thick and brand new, the air conditioner was not too noisy, but also not very cold. We had to put it down to 68 degrees to get it comfortable. Once we figured that out, it was just fine. The parking is convenient since they have locked doors on all four sided of the building that have "room key" access only. We parked within 1-2 cars of the door each night. The hallways were quiet. The breakfast food did run out a few times, however the women working there always refilled it fairly quickly. They have a computer in the lobby with 15 min. free internet per day. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: BobJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Galleria Palms October 21st to October 28th. What a terrific hotel. Here is why: #1 The location is perfect. On US 192 at marker #5. Surrounded by restaurants and only 10 minutes from Disney theme parks. The hotel is located on a side road where it is far enough off of US 192 so traffic noise is not an issue. #2 The staff was very friendly. Since this is a smaller property, the staff members recognize their guests. We were always welcomed back from the parks with a smile. #3 The rooms were perfect. When you look at their web site, that is exactly what you get. Our room had two queen pillow top beds with four pillows each and a large body pillow as well. A microwave, mini fridge, wet bar and coffe maker with an ample supply of Seattle's Best Coffee and tea. Black granite counter tops. And the feature I loved best: a 32" flat screen HDTV! The bathroom had two sinks and the shower had a rainmaker shower head that also pulsated to relax your body after a long day of walking through the theme parks. A collection of high quality Bath and Body Works soaps, lotion, shampoo and conditioners. All of this made it hard to leave the room each morning. #4 The free deluxe continental breakfast. Very, very tasty. Every morning there was waffles, biscuits and gravy and hard boiled eggs too! Along with fresh bagels, breads, mini donuts, brownies (which were more like chocolate cake!), 3 different types of cold cereal, oatmeal, coffee, tea and three different types of fruit juices. This saved us lots of money. But if you prefer, there is an IHOP and Perkins restaurant within walking distance. Everything was very fresh and tasty. My blueberry muffin tasted fresh out of the oven. I am still amazed at how good this free breakfast was. I only suggest be there before 8am. The dining room is a bit small and seems to fill up quickly. To sum it all up: this hotel is perfect for individuals, couples and families up to 4 people. It was only my wife and I, but our room could have accomodated two other people very easily and comfortably. And for the price: $500 for 7 days through Travelocity, you can't beat this hotel. We will most definately return to Galleria Palms!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: urbanguy_rd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple, without luxuries but very care and clean. The reception is not very attractive, however, the rooms are better and the furniture although it is not expensive but modern. The lady in front desk during my check in (in the afternoon) was rude, she doesn´t know what service is, I sent an email for a early check in (only 1.5 hours), the manager respond me ¨yes, not a problem¨, but without she said in very rude mode ¨The check in is at 3PM¨. The bathroom is comfortable, the amenities also. The breakfast is limited to some sweet pastry, toasts, 3 cereals, 3 types of fruits, coffee and juice, in several occasions nobody restored them and it was hardly 7:30AM o'clock, but in fact this is not a breakfast. I recommend the near restaurants as IHOP that are to a couple of minutes walking. The shuttle service was excellent, always on time, the buses a little old but under good conditions, it is not necessary to use taxis o cars, the schedules are comfortable and you can enjoy the parks in good hours. Personally I would not stay again, since for the rate there are better options with same included services.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: DAJ88
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grand-daughter, and I stayed hear for three nights and it was a perfect location for our visit to Disney. Everything was very clean and the beds were great! It was very close to everything with alot of dinning choices nearby. It is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: emma_jane22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and loved it! We were very happy, especially considering the reasonable price. The reception looks a little tired but the room itself was fantastic (our room was on the top floor - great views!). The bed was huge and comfortable, the pillows less comfortable (they were firm and also quite high). We tried the buffet breakfast on the first day and didnt rate it (I cant eat sugary sweet things for breakfast) but there are so many great places to have breakfast nearby, it wasnt a problem. The hotel pool was lovely and not busy in the late afternoon/early evenings when it was nice to have a dip during the hot weather. The hotel is in a fantastic location in Kissimmee just outside the main tourist areas (just off the I4, a few minutes drive from junction 64) and its so easy to get anywhere from there. We hired a car immediately as it is the easiest and best way to get around, plus its cheap. You can literally be at the Disney parks in minutes plus you dont have to battle through the traffic of International Drive. Parking was never an issue at this hotel. The best part is that it is AWAY from International Drive which was always congested, noisy and generally a huge headache! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Tip: DONT do the timeshare tours! They try to sell them to you in the reception area and they do offer good discounts for the parks, but they really put the "hard sell" on you, and although they say the tours are only 90 minutes, in reality, we were stuck in there for closer to three hours and missed an entire morning at the park. It wasn't worth it for the $60 we saved, and we ended up tired and stressed out. Look around for places that do discount tickets without any tours or book in advance!

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN !!!!!!!!!!!!! & Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Myself , my husband and our 10yr. old son stood here Aug.25th to Sept. 3rd. for our Disney vacation. Very impressed that what you see for the pictures on the internet is exacly what you see when you open your room door. Very clean,pillows and pillow top matresses gave us all the best sleep we have ever had at a hotel. They put on the 4th floor looking over Disney and we got to see the fireworks from Disney & Epcot each night. The breakfast was ok better than the one day we tried the Ihop in front and paid $38.00 for breakfast for 3 of us. I feel they needed two people on to keep up the restocking and cleaning the tables . But they tried the best they could.I found this and could not believe the upscale hotel it was. It was a little tight in the room due to the large furniture they have. But hey it was only to sleep.We rented a car and we were 3 miles of every park. We would stay again without a doubt. And as far as the pool it was small, but when you need cooling off it worked for us. Not anyone in it when each time we went in it!!! Thanks for a GREAT STAY!!!!!!!!!! The Rebellos

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: IWantAHolidayNow
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at this hotel in August and all in all were pleased with our stay. The hotel and rooms look just as they do on their website. The room/bathroom were clean, the carpet didn't look grubby (still kept my flip-flops on though....habit!). The beds are so comfortable! Could do with a little more storage. With 4 of us and 10 nights there were a lot of toileteries/sun creams etc we just picked up a couple of $1 baskets from Walmart to keep stuff in - like to make it easier for housekeeping. The breakfast - it was ok. It consisted of mini-muffins, mini pastries, bread, waffles, bagels, mini do-nuts, hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy. There was also either a bowl of tinned fruit salad or chopped fresh melon and some whole fruit too. The staff were a bit slack in re-stocking food though. A choice of hot coffee and teas and hot chocolate sachets. The coffee was boiling hot but the flask with hot water was tepid....warm it up in the microwave ;) As a previous poster, we had a problem with the room keys not working a couple of times but they were re-set easily at the desk - we were told that if you keep them next to credit cards they can de-activate. The pool is smallish but we weren't too bothered as we wanted to go to the waterparks. You can't see this hotel from the main road - it's set back a little way. As you head along the 192 west past marker 6, you come up to a big souvenir shop with a massive mermaid on it - take a right there. Behind the shop is an IHOP and the Meridian Palms is behind that. I'd return for the price/location/beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jdsilverm
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly read the reviews and offerings of many Disney area hotels and the Meridian was the ONLY hotel to offer everything we were looking for: a close proximity to Disney, free Wi-Fi, and a continental breakfast. Plus, the price was excellent! I knew my patience and research would pay off because we got everything we wanted in a hotel and more. When we arrived we needed a place to go to dinner. The desk clerk promptly checked us in and we had a nice discussion on nearby restaurants AND he pointed us towards a coupon book in the lobby and we ended up saving 10% off our meal! Unbelieable service in this day and age. The continental breakfast was plenty and very good. Finally, the rooms were fine. I can't say enough about how nice they were and how pleased I was with the overall experience. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traut3
Reviews.Content: Staff was very uneven-- Front Desk Manager was very service oriented and helpful, but other staff were rude and unhelpful. We had problems with the first room we were assigned (clogged drain, and a loud, leaky shower faucet). We spoke with a housekeeping or maintenance person who was very rude and refused to give us a new room. Then we talked with the Hotel Manager/Front Desk person who was very apologetic and gave us a new room immediately. The rooms have sleek, modern decor. Flat panel tv's are a luxurious amenity, and the beds are as good as everyone says. The hotel seems very clean, although the strong cleaning solutions gave my son a headache. Breakfast was adequate, but hotel was lacking in other basic amenities. No restaurant, no concierge, no gift shop--no place to even buy a newspaper or toiletry item. The location was great--half way between Disney World attractions and Universal. Another plus is that time share people were quite helpful. Although we did not agree to go to a presentation, they helped us with tickets and basic understanding of the attractions in the area... All in all, the hotel has good potential. Hope the new owners make the few tweaks that take the place to the next level.

Reviews.Title: “Good but has some problems”
Reviews.Author: bricks2721
Reviews.Content: I had checked all the websites and reviews for this hotel and it seemed like a good price for a hotel with free parking and breakfast?? The FREE BREAKFAST consisted of either sausage gravy with biscuits or hard cooked eggs and biscuits. I am on a diet and there was nothing healthy for me to eat except raisin Bran. Waffles, Bagels or toast. There are so many things they could try I wish they would. Check in was horrible Sunday late at night lady not interested in anything. Grunted gave us a key and that was it. Did not explain b-fast or how to get to room. Key did not work on outside door she siad it was probably the door. The room was nice. Beds VERY confortable, pillows great, shower great. The Bath and Body stuff for the bathroom was fantastic!! The maid service was great!! For the price we overlooked the b-fast and the hotel was fine! The shuttle servicve is non existant so DO NOT count on it!! Not far from anyhting it only took us about 15 min to get to anyhting!! IHOP in walking distance but VERY expensive and not very good. Walgreen right down the street. I would probably look for something else the next time. But for this trip it was fine. I would reccommend it!!! WE stayed from 7/30-8/4/07.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience except for the Wireless Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: AliasDonna
Reviews.Content: Newly remodeled rooms made the stay especially nice. My only problem was with the very poor wireless connection. They told me they are working on improving it, but it was very frustrating. My rating would have been Excellent if not for the Internet problem.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: justme658
Reviews.Content: Very nice, happy with everything. Great value for the price. Location was close to everything. Very short drive to magic kingdom, and seaworld, less than 5 minutes. We expected a small pool from other reviews, but it wasnt bad at all. Not ever very crowded either. We had no complaints, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking!”
Reviews.Author: ESEARev
Reviews.Content: Info online made hotel sound like it was near so many things but was really several miles from everything. Free shuttle to parks was only one time going to parks and one time coming back. Was told that we would have 2 queen beds but got a king. When I asked about a cot for our son was told they do not have cots or cribs. We switched to a room that supposedly had 2 queens but was 2 double beds. No bathtub, only small shower in a small bathroom that was not all that clean. Room was VERY small. Breakfast discription said waffles among other things but the only things they had was cold cereal, toast, danishes, juice, and coffee. We had to keep the AC set very cold because if we turned it warmer the room smelled awful. Carpets were dirty. Will NEVER stay here again! I guess you get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: homebody99
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel staff was friendly and helpful lots of restaurants close (Ponderosa, seafood, iHop, McDonalds) small grocery store across street easy to get to Disney (by car, did not use shuttle service) decent breakfast buffet (fruit! ... and excellent coffee) rooms were clean, quiet, comfortable and well equipped Cons: no laundry facilities on site (but has dry cleaning service) hard to find (look for the giant mermaid)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Al_Simmons
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Orlando, and I read the online reviews and looked at pictures of the hotel, and my wife and I decided to book it through Travelocity. The room was very modern, with Bath and Body products, a microwave, flat screen television. We loved the room...when we could get into it. We were never able to get into the room with the electronic lock the first time we tried it. Sometimes, it took up to 15 tries with the key card before the door would open. The continental breakfast was decent, but not great. We took the shuttle service to Sea World, and I was unsure as to what time the shuttle would pick us up. I called the hotel to find out, only to be told they ran out of shuttle schedules, but would give me the number to the shuttle company and I could find out for myself. Usually, a hotel will do the leg work for you, but I didn't argue and took the number. I ended up writing the number down incorrectly, so I called the hotel to give me the correct number. The line rang 13 times before disconnecting. This went on for close to 45 minutes, where I was unable to contact anyone at the front desk. The line would ring 13 times, and disconnect on each attempt. No one picked up and said "Hold please". The next night we went to the pool, only to see the switchboard sitting on top of the desk, because the young lady working the desk was sitting in front of the teleivision in the lobby with another co-worker and a gentleman that was not registered at the hotel. This gentleman later used the swimming pool as well. If our inability to contact the staff had not happened the night before, I may have excused this. Service is extremely important to me when I stay at a hotel, and the front desk staff did not live up to expectations. I would not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meridian Palms in late June 2007 during our first family vacation to WDW!! The rooms were extremely clean and nicely decorated; however, they were a little small - especially with children. There was a table and two chairs, but tucked/smashed into a corner...eating in the room was basically done on the beds. The staff was very polite and helpful. We could see Cinderella's castle (the back of) from our room - the perfect room to see the nightly fireworks show!! Our daugher loved it!! The continental breakfast was better than any other I have had - great selection. The location was great too!! There were a ton of restaurants & shops close by. All Disney attractions are within 10 minutes from the hotel! A great deal for the money. We booked through Expedia which claimed there was a kitchenette - there is not!! There is a coffee maker, microwave, and small (dorm sized) fridge - no stove top or dishware as stated in Expedia's description. That is no fault of the hotel though...their website gives accurate information. I would highly recommend this hotel...it is a great value for the money! Save your $$$ for WDW - you'll need it!!

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking!”
Reviews.Author: joellaMissionBc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week. It was okay but rooms are too small especially for one week stays. There is No closet only a small wardrobe. Hotel is like the photos we saw on-line however they include a photo of the close-by attractive restaurant which leads one to think is is part of the hotel. The breakfast was satisfactory except the photos show a waffle iron and there was No waffle iron. One morning the breakfast opened late, we had to go out to eat as we were on a schedule and there was NO compensation for it. The front desk staff were nice enough but when it came time to find the manager (re: the breakfast) she was no where to be found. There are lots of nice affortable hotels in Kissimmee..keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, new and close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: rcng24mpm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels around the Disney and Universal areas. If you are looking to stay in a moderate priced hotel in these areas, you will find most to be run down and pretty seedy for the price you pay. This hotel is different. First of all it is entrirely nonsmoking which keeps it cleaner just for that fact. It is also smaller and not real kid friendly, so that keeps the wear and tear down as well. Although the staff at this hotel are very unfriendly and don't seem to want to be bothered by you, the rooms are newer and the bathrooms are clean and beds pretty good. Overall this is a pretty good place to stay in the immediate Disney area unless you have kids

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: blpas
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel on several trips when it was a Hampton Inn. I was initially disappointed to hear that it had been sold. However, after reading several reviews on this site, I decided to give it a try on my most recent trip, and I am glad I did. We had a great stay. I requested the same room that my family had stayed in on three other trips to Disney World and was extremely pleased to see the improvements to the room. Everything is brand new and top quality. If I have any suggestions to the staff, it would be to bring back the eggs and sausage at the free breakfast in the lobby. I used a coupon from the Florida Welcome Center to book my room at a rate lower than I could find online. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, and affordable hotel that is just five minutes away (no kidding) from Disney property, this is the hotel for you. In fact, if you turn left from the parking lot, you will be on Disney property in less than a minute. Check out a map, and you will find this “secret” entrance to Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Wasen't bad for $50 a night”
Reviews.Author: guess1903
Reviews.Content: I always start out by looking at hotels.com in order to find hotels in the area I want to stay in. Then I go to the hotel's acutal website. I did this in this case of the Meridian and it ended up being $5 less per night. The hotel is kind of hidden off the main strip of 192. The lobby needed some updating but they did update the rooms. It wasen't a bad stay for $55/night on a short trip. We stayed 3 nights. We didn't use the hotels free shuttle service. We did have the "complimentary breakfast" which was all breads imaginable like bagels, toast, waffles, pastries and muffins. Overall it wasen't bad for a real short stay but my husband and I agree that we would have paid more to stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: altacanuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April of 2007. After reading many reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to stay at the Meridian. We certainly were pleased with our choice. As has been stated in several other reviews, this hotel has been refurbished and is in a great location. Rooms were very clean, well kept and spacious. We stayed in the king room. It had a great TV, lots of space and a great view of the nightly fireworks from DisneyWorld! Eliazbeth at the reception was very helpful and courteous. We did have one concern but it was addressed by the manager, Pat in an effective manner. Would we stay here again? Absolutely. Great hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied! Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: wawaweewa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at the Meridian Hotel Maingate. Here's what to expect: - small but newly renovated and elegant rooms. - very comfortable beds - bedsheets were a little too big for the bed and sometimes tend to pull out - toaster oven and mini fridge were VERY useful - great breakfast, although the same every day. Coffee was very good. - friendly staff, nothing exceptionnal but acceptable - clean pool - Disney shuttles pick you up and get you back to the hotel. However, they are only a few in the morning and in the evening, so do not miss them. Evening shuttles were a bit disorganized and did not always follow the schedule that we were given. But we always made it back to the hotel safely, sometimes later than expected. - The hotel is far from the airport, so if you are not planning to rent a car, use Mears shuttle service instead of a taxi, you will save big time. - Only wireless internet available, so don't expect to find a desktop computer for emails. Try the Howard Johnson next door. So if you want a clean, affordable and friendly hotel, this is a sure bet!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Denae
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in April 2007. I had such a wonderful experience at this hotel. I enjoyed all of the staff they were very courteous and friendly ecspecially Elizabeth who works the front desk. I would highly recommend this hotel over any other. Thank you for a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Three star service for a two-star price”
Reviews.Author: TexasMouseHunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights in April of 2007 and we couldn't be happier about the quality and service. The hotel has been freshly renovated since the new management took over from Hampton Inn and the rooms are spotless. You can even smell a hint of the fresh paint. Big screen plasma TVs are a plus and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast is no feast but it is enough to satisfy two young daughters for seven mornings in a row and saved us a bundle. You can always walk next door to IHOP if you want more. There are about six good restaurants within walking distance. The pool is a bit small but enough for the kids to enjoy. The staff was excellent- I recommend you talk to the marketing director, Elizabeth. I would hire her on the spot if I could. Our only disappointment was the shuttle service. I mistakenly thought that a shuttle service meant you could catch a ride to the parks every few hours or so. Not the case. Shuttles leave at 7:20 AM and get back in the mid and late evening. If you don't like that timeline, it is a $20 cab ride one way. We worked around this and eventually rented a car from Avis to buy us some flexibility. Still not a bad deal. I would strongly recommend this hotel if you want something off-park, very clean, and you are willing to work your schedule around the sparse shuttle service or pay for a cab or rental.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: alanamom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful experience. We stayed for only one night Saturday 03/17/2007. First of all LOCATION! LOCATION! This is just 1 mile from Disney you are right there and do not miss a beat. Check in was a breeze and the staff was very helpful the lady at the front desk even gave us a nice surprise, since it was the kids (2 ½ and 1 ½) first time in Disney she gave us a room with fireworks view. If we looked out the window between 8 and 10 we would see them. Cool little perk I did not expect. Room was on the 4th floor and it was spotless. Everything looked exactly as on the website. Modern room with great amenities including refrigerator, microwave, coffee and flat panel cable TV and everything worked great. Bathroom was very clean and they provided good quality soaps and shampoo, conditioner and lotion. The bed was super comfortable the only thing I did not like were the pillows (to thick for me). Breakfast was included and it was your basic mix of waffles, bagels, mini muffins, cereal, fruit and drinks. I will definitely stay here again. It was an excellent hotel for the money – great buy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Dustinmc24
Reviews.Content: The Meridian hotel is a good hotel for a good price. It is about 15-20 minutes from Disney. The rooms are nicely equipped and we had a good stay at the Meridian. ROOMS: They are small but well equipped. Be warned that the rooms are very small. There was not a lot of room to store our suitcases and because we only had 2 we found places to put them. However, they are well decked out with very pretty furniture. Ours had a desk, fridge, microwave, and dresser you could hang shirts on. The king size bed was comfortable and the pillows were very comfy. My bedspread did get loose but it wasn't an issue for the most part. The AC works well mainly because the room is so small that it doesn't take long to cool it down. There is a flat screen TV, which is a very nice perk. That spoiled me a bit and I enjoyed watching TV before going to bed on the flat screen. There are quite a few channels to choose from as well. The bathroom is nice and the shower is a good size. The shower has plenty of room and the shower head has different settings as well. The shower gets steamy quick so you may want to open the door as soon you finish with your shower. I wish there was more lighting over the sink, it was hard for my wife to put on makeup with the lackluster lighting. I had a hard time putting on my contacts. I think the hotel should put up another light over the sink and that could easily be fixed. The walls are a little thin and I could hear people walking and talking in the halls. The lighting in the rest of the room is good once you find the light switches. SERVICE/LOCATION: Fast and easy. The hotel is in good shape. The location is right off 192 and the tollway. If you are leaving Disney you can take the tollway and then make a left at 192 and bypass the traffic on 192. This will get you back within 20 minutes from the park. The distance to the park isn't far but traffic can be heavy especially on the weekends. This makes the short trip to the park seem longer. The toll will cost 50­ cents. They sell Disney tickets at the hotel too. The rooms were clean and housekeeping did a good job (I wish they had not forgot to replace the kleenex when it ran out, though). They have a shuttle to Disney but we didn't use it so I can't rate that experience. BREAKFAST: They have the standard items on their free breakfast (cofee, juice, milk, bagels, toast,oatmeal, & danishes). They also have a waffle heater and you can make your own waffles. They do a good job stocking it up. I will warn you that by 9:30am the waffles will run out and many items will be running low. The coffee is good, the bagels aren't very good, but the waffles are very good. It is busy in there and expect there to be a lot of people there. If you feel like some eggs and bacon, there is a McDonald's and Hoolihan's next door. Overall, it was a good experience and since we got a good deal for the room that made it even better. I would recommend this for people who are in a small group (1-2 people). We would go back to the hotel again next trip we take to Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice!”
Reviews.Author: vacationersthere
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel to stay on a budget. Check-in was a breeze and the clerk behind the counter was nice. Like everyone says the room are smaller than normal. I made use of every available space in the room. There are places to store your bags in the room. You just have to be crafty. Even though there is no tub, the shower is big enough to stand a child off to the side and wash them up. This is exactly what I did with my two year old. The beds were very comfortable and we slept great after a long day in the park. We did not have any problems with the sheets coming off of the bed. A tip for breakfast in the mornings- get there between 7:00 and 7:20. After that it will be crowded in the breakfast area. The only disappointment I had was that the keyboard to the computer was supposedly broken. Then I ask two days later and they told me the whole computer system was taken away. This was very inconvenient for me being that I am taking online classes and I could not do any work for 4 days. I was told to go to the library and get online if I needed, but that would not work, because the library does not stay open that late. Other than that everything was fine with the hotel. The Meridian Palms is closer to the main gate and there are more restaurants around besides Mc Donald's and Holigans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nenex03
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice & CLEAN! The rooms had everything you needed. The staff were all excellent, Timmy, John & Filomena were totally awesome and helped you as much as they could. They really were short staffed and need more customer service. The rooms are great for 1 0r 2 people. The King size bottom sheets didn't stay on the bed right, need better fitting sheets, other wize the beds were very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Beats Staying in Disney”
Reviews.Author: tripster96
Reviews.Content: Meridian Palms couldn't have been better. Our family of four stayed here, while my brother-in-law and his family stayed inside the Disney World Park. They hopped the tram from their hotel and got to the park in a couple of minutes. We drove a mile to the park and and got their a few minutes later. The big difference: we ate a free breakfast; my brother in law shelled out $80 to start the day. When it came time for souvenirs we felt comfortable splurging because of the money saved on meals and bought a few in the park and a few more T-shirts, etc. at the discount shop across the street from our hotel. The rooms were very updated. I especially appreciated the extra sink outside the main bathroom so I could blow dry my hair while the kids took showers. We weren't stuck in one park. We went to Universal Studios and Disney; my brother-in-law didn't get to ride the new roller coasters at Universal's Island of Adventure. We ate dinner at Epcot and Universal but also had a chance to relax and catch our breath at a nice Italian Restaurant outside the park. (Get away from amusement park fare.) To top it all off, when we first arrived late the first night, I realized I'd left toiletries at home and dreaded a time-consuming trip to the drug store, but the hotel staff gladly supplied me with what I needed right at the front desk. Rose Turlik

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrBGreene
Reviews.Content: This was a really great find. I booked the hotel for a great price and was pleasently supprised to find the hotel looking just like it did on the website. The staff were extremley friendly (if not a little long-winded at times), the hotel was clean and tidy, the room was Great (King Suite) and the location was awesome. I had a great stay here; not too many kids running around , great surroundings just off of 192, Great view from the 5th floor. It was about a 8-9 minute drive to Disney and about 15 minutes to Universal. The breakfast that was provided was just what I was looking for, nothing too heavy. I would reccomend this place to anyone looking for a deal in Orlando. Hope this helps some one to have a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claire16c
Reviews.Content: I take it the name of the Hotel has changed since we stayed there. It was the Hampton Inn Maingate West then. So unless anything has changed since the name change, this hotel was great. It was a perfect base for exploring the parks. The rooms were clean, the beds were huge and there were 2, a tv, coffee maker, fridge was was a good size. The bathroom was also a good size and very clean. We didnt use the pool because the weather was not hot enough in January when we were there but it looked fine when we had a quick walk around it when we first got there. We loved the freshly cooked cookies we got each evening, and the morning breakfasts had everything you could want. There was also a very good shuttle service to the Disney parks, which you could then transfer onto the Disney shuttle if you wanted to go to a park that the hotel shuttle did not go to. It also went to Seaworld and Universal. This was great and meant we could stay in the hotel without renting a car, and we were in walking distance of restaurants in the evening. This was important for us as we are under 25 so renting a car is very expensive. I would definitely stay here again, it was the cheapest hotel I could find with good reviews and it was just that.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: disneydreams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel two months before the arrival date and even received an email saying that they were looking forward to our stay. However we received a call two days before we were supposed to be there informing us that they were not even open and that our reservations had been switched to their sister hotel. We spent a lot of time researching the hotels in hopes of having a nice stay since this was our honeymoon! All that research and then we get a call too late to do further reseach for another hotel. The other hotel was fine but not what we had booked. When we arrived at the sister hotel and told the woman behind the counter that we had just been called two days prior, she seemed shocked and apologized to us. Her reaction told me that they knew they were not going to be open for some time and that it was just poor management that waited so late to call. Regardless of how nice or clean the hotel may be it is not a good business to do its customers this way. Even more after we got back home we got another email from the closed hotel thanking us for our stay. Very unprofessional and disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Collegebookstore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 days in Dec 2006. The room itself is indeed very small, certainly not much room to walk around or to place your luggage. But the fittings and furniture and layout are excellent. Gotta love the tv :) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: thepeters
Reviews.Content: Heard about and booked this property on Resideo and had a good stay last weekend for a short spur-of-the-moment trip. The Meridian is located on Highway 192, only a few miles from the main Disney World entrance, and close to plenty of area restaurants and shops. The property and rooms are in OK condition. Rooms are small, but they make the most of the space. Each has a flat screen TV on the wall and a unit that hold clothes, microwave/toaster unit, mini-fridge and shelves. Morning breakfast is filling -- waffle-maker, muffins, biscuits, cereals and drinks. Although seating is limited, the staff keeps everything stocked. This was a last-minute choice, and we were happy for the most part -- it was worth the money spent and we'd stay again if we ever need a "let's go to Disney tomorrow" sort of trip.

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: hoteltoom
Reviews.Content: the room was fixed, the bed got clean sheets, but the room smell bad, the A/C you can't sleep when it's on or off, it blows air directly to your bed, the fridg was so loud, the room is so small that you can't even walk around the bed, it's may be good for one person who does not want to pay alot, I got the room for $48, I think $25 for this room is ok, the beakfast is kind of poor, I would not stay in this hotel again, it's not close to anything.

Reviews.Title: “not for us”
Reviews.Author: footwin
Reviews.Content: we were given poor instructions on how to get there, and ended up at the other meridian hotel, the only way we found it was when we recognised it from the brochure. On entering the hotel we found it nice enough the rooms were nice, but we were to tired to care.The next morning we had our breakfast with the builders who were measuring up,not impressed! We then looked at the bus schedule to the theme parks to find there was one bus in morning at about 9am then picked you up at 10pm, considering we chose this hotel so that we didn't have to do much driving it was not suitable, so we upgraded and moved out,no complaints about the cleanliness or anything it just did not suit my family.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cybersavy1
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. A little too far west on 192 and tons of traffic going back east to disney. Hotel renovated, room was okay, but very small quarters. You must play bump and tag with your partner. The nice furniture is to big for the small room. Small bathroom, with sliding door. Spongy bed, uncomfortable sleep, sheets keep sliding off the corners. Great Tv, flat screen mounted on wall. On the front of building it has big sign Free Wireless Available. But, guess what? No wireless in rooms or lobby or restaurant. Definitely not worth $69.00. Possibly half price.

Reviews.Title: “Was a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: soccermom635
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews on this hotel, even up till the day before we left, and all seemed favorable. I even made notice of the fact that everyone said it's hard to find because it sets back behind IHOP. We found IHOP, we drove down the Maingate, there was another hotel, the Meridan Palms, and the Radisson ... couldn't find the Hampton Inn. We decided to ask in the Meridan what was up, and low and behold - this was the new hotel name, but we were never notified. Most of the staff was very helpful, but there was young gentleman who was there most of the time we passed by the desk, who wasn't very willing to be helpful. I brought my emailed confirmation which stated the rates that we booked it at, and an additional notation that we were entitled to a AAA discount upon arrival. We got there, and he informed me that we were not entitled to the AAA discount, it was discontinued under the new ownership. (Finally on our last day, there was a young lady at the desk who once I explained things to her, along with having my confirmation email, was very happy to give us the discount.) The elevator was a big problem area. My family and I did not mind walking the stairs - afterall, we were going to all the parks, lots of walking involved. However, we were there for 7 nights, and the elevators had an 'Out of Order' sign on them for about 4 days. We didn't mind, but there were several elderly people there during the beginning of our stay, and that may have been taxing for them. 4 days without the service was 3 days too many. On the days it was actually working, we noticed that there were always lines at the elevator. The breakfast was very disappointing. The fruit (apples and oranges) always looked bad; fruit salad looked like a bunch of canned fruits thrown in a bowl, a couple mornings there were cold waffles - but the breakfast consisted of muffins, bagels, toast, danish - it was just all starchy things, not much of a variety. Several of the people had mentioned the coffee all day, and the cookies that were put out. That is one of the discontinued things under the new management. The air conditioner was incredibly noisy, but we couldn't turn it off since it was 90+ degrees everyday. And, our room had a bizarre, odor to it. It wasn't a normal musty odor, it was that plus something else we just couldn't figure out. But, our room was clean. Beds were decently comfortable. I wish I could say I'd stay there again, but I probably wouldn't. I'm sure that the others who raved about it, may be a bit disappointed if they return. Maybe with some time to be up and running, the new management will try to bring things back that people found appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week while visiting Disney World. The pictures online paint a highly exaggerated view of the quality of this establishment. The rooms are tiny, and everything about them feels cheap. I understand that the price is low so I don't expect a Hilton, but I travel for a living and stay in hotels about 150 days a year, and this was definately the worst for the money, in other words I've stayed in better cheaper hotels. Anyway, about a week after leaving we got $350 charged to our credit card! We called them and they said it was for a broken desk. There was a busted leg on the desk and it was there when we got there. We just didn't think to report it. So we got billed $350 for a ----- desk! I tried to deal with their manager but since they are a bad business, their management is always being changed around so you can't talk to anyone really in charge. It used to be a Choice Hotel, and now it is not.... hmmmm.... probably a reason for that... I will definately never stay there again and I recomend you find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a little over hyped but still a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: balearicrazy
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the Hampton in late June 2006 after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor, I was actually surprised to find that I couldn't agree with all the comments on here, some of them seem a little OTT for this hotel, its basically an average 2 star hotel, nothing really too special about it however that is not to say that it isn't keep extremley clean and the staff are friendly. The breakfast at the hotel is average, even quite poor compared to other simliar price and rated hotels I have stayed in around the US. While I was there, tables where frequently not cleaned and bins were left to overflow. There is also only seating for shy of 50 people in the breakfast room, the hotel is 5 stories, so you can imagine some of the problems on busy days! The lifts in the hotel where subject to a few jokes from hotel guests and even cleaning staff while I was at the hotel, it may have been a temporary problem (although no action was taking on it in the 5 days I was there) however they are extremley slow, you can be waiting for several minutes for a lift and only one lift was working at a time. The location from Disney World though is fantatasic, like others have rightfully mentioned, it takes less than 10 minutes from hotel car park to theme park. There are also several shops (gift shops mainly) and fast food / family resturants within walking distance, we found the pizza place was very friendly. The rooms that we had where pretty good, there is coffee making facilities in the room. The air conditioner unit is rubbish though, very noisy, the worst I have ever come across, we had to turn it off at night in order to sleep. The hotel common areas have limited air con as well and so can get uncomfortably warm. The pool area was nice enough, there is complimentary towels pool side as well as a few loungers. Believe it or not, I'm actually not a fussy customer, please feel free to read my other reviews, however I could not help but feel a little disapointed in this hotel. Overal I would recommend staying here if simply for the price, location and cleanliness of the hotel, however I would say don't get your hopes up too high, this hotel also has several shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for One or Two People”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Looked newish and was a convenient place to stay close to Disney. We had a refriderator and convection oven. My son and I got a two bed room for $43 w/tax through leisurelink.com. Great deal and priced accordingly. Rates on web is $99. Would not pay $99. Bathroom was separate from sink area. Not much room for more than two people. Very small room. I would recommend for one or two people or a couple with one child. It has a pool, however, we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly and very conveniently located. Nice quiet location. We were on Honeymoon and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton for 7 nights with my family and I was quite impressed. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews from TripAdvisor. My main concern about staying at any hotel is how clean it is. On many occasions I had walked out of hotels because the room seem unclean. The mattresses, bathroom and carpets were immaculate. I would definitely stay here again. It was very difficult to find so make sure you have instructions how to get there. The breakfast was always fresh and my kids just loved the cookies and milk at 8:00pm. This was a great value for the money. Parking is free and it is located just minutes from disney.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Redjazz68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30 April to 5 May 2006. Older property but renovated. Large room with 2 double beds. Clean spacious bathroom with bath. Set back slightly off main road so it is quiet. Free shuttle to Disney and Universal. Not flexible with pick up and drop off times but you work around it, hey it's free. Nice pool area. Plenty of free car parking. Lots of restaurants in walking distance and a couple of smaller supermarkets. Included breakfast is very good. No guest laundry which is annoying if you are there for a longer time. We went across to the Holiday Inn on reception's recommendation, no problem. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a beautiful holiday in sunny Orlando. This is my 5th trip there. We have always stayed at this hotel even after the name/ownership change and I can definitely vouch that it just gets better each time. The hotel has been renovated so that the rooms are luxurious and clean and they are catered with all the facilities you'd need. Breakfast is good and the staff are wonderful. You really get more than you pay for and it deserves a 4* rating in my books. The Disney parks are so close by - if you have been going there as long as us, you get to know all the short cuts and avoid the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant,”
Reviews.Author: rtgt
Reviews.Content: It has been way to long in writing this review, we stayed at this property at the end of June 2005, when Orlando was getting all the rain. We stayed 5 nites and although the room was very small the service of the motel was great. All staff were very friendly. I see that it has changed hands and that renos have been done. the renos look great and for the value I would have no concerns in staying at this property in the future. Besides what are the people wanting when they can pay less than $50.00 per nite. The breakfast was great as well. If you are concerned about the room size, go for the 2 beds opposed to the one bed, those rooms appear to be bigger. Location was fine and it only took about 10 minutes to Disneyworld. Great pool area, very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: cwc54
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and I was not disappointed. First a few minor negatives: The hotel is located behind a building, off the beaten path which is great for noise (the poolside was very quiet; no traffic sounds) but I had a hard time finding it in the dark, after a very long day at EPCOT. Also, I could hear voices in the hall when I was in my room, but it wasn't a problem. These were very minor annoyances in comparison to all of the positives - the excellent service, the cleanliness, the price, the very comfortable beds (loved the pillows!) and the free breakfast. I ate out at poolside, and there were staff members out there in the early morning hours, tidying and cleaning. The property was very clean, inside and out. I received an email confirmation just prior to my trip, and a "welcome home" email when I returned, asking for feedback. Customer satisfaction seems to be their number one priority. All this for about 100 bucks. Can't beat the value.

Reviews.Title: “New paint makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just recently arrived from one of my Orlando getways trips that I take often. I was able to get a hopper 5 day pass to Universal Studios & Island of Adventure for $78 on fleabay. So I decided to stay for the whole 5 days & get the most out of my vacation. Originally I was supposed to stay at the Comfort-Inn, at Int’l Drive for $65 (mil/gov) discount but I cancelled when I booked here with lastminutetravel.com for $41.80. I pretty much know all the cheap & expensive motels/hotels in Kissimmee & Orlando & this is my first at this location. So the property is under new management/ownership & as of December of last year the renovations are supposed to be completed. So let’s get started & see how this hotel ranks among the many flea-motels in Kissimmee. THE ROOM For the price that I got this shouldn’t be any surprise about what to expect. At first I was kinda regretting the switch from the Comfort to Meridian but it was way worth it at the end. The rooms have been renovated with new carpet, furniture, bed & a 26” lcd monitor. They have either a room with one king bed or one with 2 queens. The bathrooms were also re-done but the lack of good house keeping has already started to show the mildew & tear & wear from irregular maintenance. The rooms are really small & I mean small; perhaps the smallest I have ever stayed in so far. Everything is crammed in, from the desk to the ironing board. There’s not much room to move around, my girl & I bumped to each other every morning trying to get ready for the parks. The room I stayed in was the executive unit which has a king size bed. I thought of going with the Family unit which isn’t any bigger & it comes with 2 queens but the price was a big difference so I booked the executive unit. (yes I’m cheap like that!!) THE BATHROOM You have a vanity & a shower (no bathtub) which I liked. There was plenty of water pressure & the towels were clean & soft. You might wanna ask for additional ones since they only give you two. The only thing that I found about the bathroom which I already have mentioned is the cleanliness around the shower. Perhaps since they only have one cleaning lady cleaning; well at least that I saw, the mildew is growing like crazy. In a few months the bathrooms are going to be in the same shape they were before renovations. LOCATION This location is for folks that want to go to Disney Theme Parks since it is very West in 192 & I mean West. Anymore West & you’ll end up in 27 (Okeechobee). The good thing of being so out West is that the hotel is very quiet. Not much action anywhere for the exception of the parking for the Hoolihans which is right in front of this hotel. If you don’t have a car then you’re SOL. They do offer a complementary shuttle to all parks but you’re on their time & terms. They pick you up early & bring you late. There’s no in between hours for those the want to sleep in a little. So once you’re in the park you’re pretty much stuck there for the duration. No calling for early pickup or special hours if you wish to change & head out again. So for the native if you have a car you should be fine, for the non-native well rent one if you have the budget. If you’re going to anywhere else other than Disney then you’ll be doing some driving. Overall I was not disappointed with the Meridian. If you could get a good price on the rooms then stay here. The staff was nice & they answer all my questions. BTW: take a look at the pics I took & posted

Reviews.Title: “loved the new room and a great bed”
Reviews.Author: kaygold
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Meridian for four nights. Got a new room. It is small, very small, with just a shower no bath. All the furniture and carpeting and bathroom fixtures were new as was the bed, drapes, and bedding. My husband bought me a memory foam mattress at home and I thought this bed was just as comfortable or even more so. When I checked in, I ask for the last room to be renovated. She gave me the 3rd floor end which she said were the last ones to be fixed-up. It has a convection oven (which I didn't use because I had never used one before and I didn't know how.)It was brand new too. As well as a plasma TV on the wall. All the stuff in the breakfast room was new too. It did have canned fruit and also a make your own waffle machine. They had two women working the breakfast room and they keep everything well supplied. When I first arrived, I had second thoughts because I am so picky. The hallways and the elevator hasn't been renovated yet and that worried me so I asked to see a room first. I was impressed with the room. I also had problems with the toliet. Ours keep running every 10-15 minutes. It kept waking me up the first night. So, we kept the fan on and shut the door the rest of the nights. I did report it but no one fixed it. The bath room did have a state of the art shower head. I travel a lot and I haven't seen one like that before. They are selling the rooms as condos. I thought that was real strange. They are so small. But the girl on the front desk said a person could either keep the rooms for themselves or rent it out for income. I am still real confused about that. I don't know how someone could make a profit with those rooms and pay for all the help involved. Anyway, my stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great since Renovation”
Reviews.Author: daytonagirlie
Reviews.Content: I was initially apprehensive booking this hotel - it has changed hands three times (?) lately, is listed as a one to two star place, and while the TripAdvisor rating is three stars, all the recent reviews have been pretty bad - and I'm always leery of new owners. I'm a cheapskate, though, and this place SOUNDED perfect: we need (ha!) high speed internet, preferably wireless. I wanted a room with a microwave and a fridge, and my husband wanted a place with free breakfast. I liked the location a lot, and it was cheap - $65 a night for the 'executive' suites, or $75 for the family suites. Executives come with a king bed, and Families get two queens. The hotel swore up and down that they had been totally renovated, just completed, and was now a collection of "Luxury Suites." We are easy to please - give us a clean room, a clean bathroom, and basic security, and we're going to be alright - so I booked the room. We checked in sort of late on Wednesday - about 10:00. The woman at the front desk was tired but friendly, and got us checked in right away. We were given a room on the second floor right next to the stairs and a big security door (which didn't actually need a room key to open.) We were concerned that the heavy door would be opening and closing all night, but apparently people are lazy and take the elevator down the hall when they came in, because we only heard it a handful of times. The room was small, but well appointed - a large king bed, a granite topped desk and a matching nightstand, 'Refreshment Center,' and wardrobe closet thingie with drawers and hangers, as well as a nice coffeemaker, small convection oven, and fridge. The TV was indeed a flatscreen - the thing was huge! I think my husband wants one now =) The bathroom area was nice, very clean, and I LOVED the shower enclosure. All the free soaps and stuff are from bath and body works, and we never got the same stuff twice - cool stuff, too. While we never even used the (very cool) convection oven, and only barely used the fridge, I was glad to have them. The internet was only wireless in the lobby - we had to use a plug in unit, which meant only one of us could use the internet at a time, which was a hassle but not a huge problem. I'd probably rate this hotel a 3.5 star, but I'm calling it a 4 instead of 3 as my rating because of the included amenities. I would reccomend this place to everyone - at least room 200 is leaps and bounds above those pictures posted.

Reviews.Title: “reviews dont lie ?”
Reviews.Author: philiplb
Reviews.Content: Normally i wouldnt think of staying in a budget price hotel,not because i think i am to good for them, but i have one or two health issues that leave me needing a certain level of comfort.But i never really had any worries booking to stay at the Hampton because i have previously stayed at other hotels in America that have had good reviews on this site.Basically without writing a long and drawn out review i will just say this: clenliness was excellent beds were very comfortable,nice fluffy pillows air con worked very well.not too noisy friendly staff bathroom clean,plenty hot water room always well cleaned free breakfast free shuttle buses(check the times if staying at end of one month and start of another,they change the timetable each month) and free cookies with as much milk or coffee as you wish in the evenings when you get back from the parks, The best compliment that i can pay the Hampton is that i will make sure next time we go to Florida we will definately stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw the reviews here, and decided to stay at this hotel. I loved every single moment while I was there. We have a 17 months old boy and cleaness was the most important factor for us, and I was so satisfied how clean the hotel was. After tiring day at Disney, you just want to come back to a clean place to relax and rest. Also, staffs were so friendly, great breakfast just like reviews written below~ If I get to go to Orlando again, this is where I will be staying!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wizzi
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly staff, nice pool, usual Hampton Inn breakfast, good location very close to Disney attractions. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Croftsfamily
Reviews.Content: We changed our hotel to Hampton Inn after reading negative reviews on the first booked hotel, and decided not to risk it.We visited Hampton Inn after reading reviews posted. It was everything the reviews said it was. Clean, small, friendly staff and guests and a fantastic free breakfast and cookies and milk at night - not to mention free coffee and tea in reception all day. The pool was suitable for the size of the hotel - very clean and we were the only family around it most of the time - plenty of chairs and beds and towells. The location of the hotel was spot on, and seemed to be used mainly by business people on short stay. We had clean towells daily, and bedding every 3 days. We never had cause to complain, so can not comment on how quick they were to resolve issues. I would definatley recomend this hotel - if you do not need a bar or restaurant, then this is perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well located and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews on this hotel we booked this hotel. It was well worth it. Great location for disney especially animal kingdom, 5 minutes drive. Extensive breakfast with something hot everyday. The pool was small but very adequate after a long day at the parks. They even provided pool towels. We did have a problem with the room allocated to us when we arrived it smelled of smoke. No problem, they immediately allocated another room. We asked for more towels and blankets on the same day, no problem, within half an hour the towels arrived. It was a friendly and well equipped hotel. 4 star facilites on a 3 star budget!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading all the positive Trip Advisor reviews, thinking that so many people couldn't be wrong! We can now vouch that they're certainly not wrong! It is a clean modern attractively furnished hotel with a friendly welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are very well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast really is excellent and there's free wireless internet if you've brought your laptop or PDA to keep an eye open for possible hurricane activity! All the staff were great. We had one problem when the air conditioner was making our carpet wet. As soon as we reported it we were offered a different room or the maintenance guy would fix it immediately - which he did including vacuum drying the carpet EVEN THOUGH IT WAS 7.30 IN THE EVENING! I wish home repair men were so efficient .. We initially intended to stay just 3 nights on our way to Sarasota and ended up coming back for 5 more nights on the way back! Given the low season rates this is one of the best value hotels we have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, Top Location.”
Reviews.Author: room_512
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hampton Inn Maingate West. What can I say apart from it was superb. 5 minutes to Disney via the back route through the Disney Offices car park, right on the US192, cookies and milk at suppertime, excellent continental breakfast in the morning, well looked after rooms, no problems parking. Book your stay - its highly recommended, we would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Disney”
Reviews.Author: alexperi
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after extensive research through tripadvisor, and was not disappointed. It's a great Hampton Inn, nice staff, amazing location, 5 minutes from Animal Kingdom. Can't imagine a better hotel for a Disney stay. Would definitely return here.
